text:
This is a great place for 100% vegan restaurant. As their tagline vegan option screw that we are 100% vegan. 
We ordered supreme fries which was really supreme. Hot fries with glucamole, mushrooms and pico. 
And we ordered burger combo with coke. The burger was really good, crunchy with some onions and fresh lettuce. The patty was tasty. 

The prices are reasonable for vegan food. 

The portions were really sumptuous. We had to get a to go box for fries.

This right hereeeee. This right hereee is the best taco maco loco moco shop in town boys and girls. You get to not only save precious animal lives by eating vegan but the meals are hands down the best. I will continue to come here as long as I have money in my pocket. I cannot recommend this place enough! Go now!

We were a little scared to go because the parking lot of it is surrounded by junk cars. But WOW! The food was so tasty and delicious you couldn't tell it was vegan! Even my dad who was really skeptical gave it two thumbs up! Super delicious will be going back for sure!
Love the street tacos! but need to step up the game on the salsas

This may be the best vegan food in Vegas. I have tried every single place so far and it is between here and Veggie House. My only complaint is that the computer system they use to put orders down may be flawed or the way they communicate with the cooks, because sometimes they get a mixed up order here and there due to how busy they stay, but they always accommodate if they do mess up. Overall this place is amazing!!! And a must try!
This place is incredible. Everything is delicious, and I loved that the choices of "meats" included cactus, and mushrooms. Aside from the food, the customer service is exemplary also.
This place is amazing! Thank goodness for a Mexican VEGAN place! I've had the rolled potato taquitos and they are very good. Wish they would stay open past 8 p.m.
Vegas, delicious, quick to serve, and we got all sorts of other dish samplers so we can taste them.

Took my gf here because she doesn't eat meat and omfg we loved it! We got the 3 taco combo it came with rice and beans, your choice of drink and whatever filling for your taco. We picked the chickin, al pastor, and asada, hands down it tasted delicious and guilt free.  We also got the asada fries they were delicious too. We will definitely be going back. Their prices are reasonable. I hope they don't raise them!! Only thing that was a bummer was that they didn't have air conditioning only a fan in the corner of the room so the wait was a little uncomfortable. Hopefully they get one in soon because this desert heat is no joke.

Authentic feel starts with the bright orange walls and soccer match broadcasting on the radio. 
Greeted by handsome gentleman, who is sincerely passionate about welcoming his guests and getting them fed quickly. 
Horchata to rice pudding to tamales! All vegan! 
Go now.
Fast service. Their breakfast burritos were huge and super delicious. It looks like all their burritos are very large.

Food is amazing. As a family we Ordered posole,  super fries, and green chili wet burrito all asada. 
I was dancing in my sit the whole time I was eating.
Nice staff. A little put off that you went up to the counter to order, but food was brought to your table. I was hoping for more flavor, but the flavor was good.
Good food, prices are reasonable. I tried their soft street tacos YUMMY!!!. The place is a little hidden because it's behind a gas station but I will totally go there again.
Bomb food! Also, everything is vegan! Which means I don't have to worry about what I can and cannot order on their menu.

My partner and I stopped in while in town to get some quick vegan food and we were both blown away! Both of the employees we interacted with were very kind and informative and the food was great! We ate our original meal then went back again later in the day to order more before leaving town. I had the asada, mushroom, chick-ens, and cactus tacos and would suggest all of them (but chick-ens was my favorite).

I have been here many, many times and I am always very pleased! The place is a bit of a hole-in-the-wall but the food is always good! The staff are very friendly and the restroom is always clean. My favorite dish is the wet burrito with chorizo and green sauce. It's huge and can probably feed 2 adults easily.

My husband and I had been wanting to go here for weeks now.  We finally ate there last night, we were not let down; the food was great!  We live on the northwest side of the valley, but still plan on coming here at least once a month.  The place was really busy, they had a fairly steady flow of people coming in.  I just wish it was closer to us.

YOU NEED TO EAT HERE. 

The meal I had at Pancho's was hands down the best meal I've had IN MY LIFE. NO JOKE, this place is INCREDIBLE. I had the street tacos, sopes, and a pineapple tamale and I could not even give one area or thing to improve if my life depended on it. The flavours were amazing, you can really taste the love in their cooking. The staff were friendly and helped me navigate the menu. I'm so glad I made the trip here from the strip, so worth it. If I lived in Vegas I would eat here every day.

I had been wanting to go to this place forever! I had never heard of it until it popped up in my sponsored feed on instagram. Drove from Centennial Hills and it was worth the drive. If it was closer I'm sure I would frequent more often. I love the burger. Stayed formed and didn't fall a part like most vegan burgers. Highly recommended...

So yummy!!! This place left me in the good kind of food coma. I had the A la Mexicana breakfast burrito and shared the Supreme Fries w/mushrooms. I couldn't finish either because I was so full but I'm looking forward to having my leftovers for dinner!!! I will be back in the future, that's for sure.

I tried this place and was very hopeful after reading mixed reviews. So- their food is decent but not like super good. Their soups are delicious- prob my favorite part of my order. The carnitas street tacos were pretty good, wish they had a bit more seasoning on the "meat", their red salsa was bomb so I just slathered it with that and lime juice, you could almost not tell it wasn't actually meat. I also ordered the potato rolled tacos and was not impressed- it's like two French fries in a corn tortilla and then I specifically asked them to put the cheese on the side (because sometimes I don't like vegan cheeses and I did not like theirs), but they put the cheese all over my tacos anyway and when I called to complain (via Grubhub) because I couldn't eat the tacos with the nasty cheese all over them I was told that my order was right and that they put the cheese on the side and I will not be refunded. They did agree to refund me for the horchata that I order and didn't receive. 

My overall take is I wish this place had better customer service. If they screw up your order and you can't eat it because of it, you will not be refunded- they will blame the customer and you'll be out of money. Really bad bad service, wish it wasn't so... I won't be returning for that specific reason. It's the principle...they said I was lying about my food being wrong instead of taking responsibility for their mistake. 

Okay so today it's over a month since I wrote the review for Panchos and I was literally like attacked on Facebook by them for writing a real review and in their response they just straight up completely lied, then made it so I couldn't even respond to them because I guess they needed "the last word". Big tip- don't accuse your customers of lying when they are not. I'm not the only person commenting on your awful customer service. Just fix it!!! I've attached a pic of the Facebook post where they were upset about my review and then disabled me from responding. To be clear- they never offered a refund like I've detailed before. And Grubhub was not the issue, they were. I will still use Grubhub to order food but will never go to this place, that says something!  Also, I found a vegan place here in Vegas I love called vegetation and they don't blame their customers or try to shift the blame to Grubhub when they mess up, I promise!  

Maybe the next time they get a bad review they will actually reach out to the customer to correct it instead of just lying on the internet and saying they did. The management here are just straight up liars. Bad service, don't go!!!!

Went here for the first time today and was super surprised at how cool of a place this is. There's lots of space inside, the hosts are friendly and there's so many food options. Unfortunately, I won't return soon because I'm visiting from L.A., I wish we had a location like this in our city because our only Mexican options are overpriced and non-authentic. I can't believe they have sopa de fideo here, and sopes! This is exactly how vegan Mexican food should be, affordable and simply good.
This place is awesome! Great food for a good price. I couldn't even tell that the food was vegan. Best vegan in town!
Game changer! Sooo good, portions are generous. Can't wait to work my way through the whole menu.

This place is sooooooooo good. The food is extremely delicious!!!! I love this food. Great concept and fantastic execution. The location is convenient and is totally worth the trip. I highly recommend, you won't be disappointed.
The people were really helpful and patient while we decided what would be good for us. The food was amazing and came out fast. You definitely don't have to worry about leaving hungry.

Very delicious and great food portions for the price! We went here for my little brother's birthday (he is vegan). Even though I am not vegan, this restaurant really impressed me and I could not tell the difference in taste at all. I highly recommend this place to all my friends and fam
Vegan food so good you forget is vegan. Btw I am more of a meat-a-tarian. Wait time is a bit rough. But at least it's fresh.
Food is amazing! Sometimes it's hard to find a place where the food is healthier and good. This place is both. Fresh food, cheap, and delicious. The staff is super friendly.

This place is good the food is good everything but one thing has to change to call it a restaurant... why. I say that cause there's really no ppl who come to take your plate and we're u put your is pretty unstable because u add your plate to other dirty plates and that's really not my thing l like to put my plate somewhere clean
Food was great! Cashier was very friendly too. Wish there were more vegan places like this.
Went here Sunday after going to church with my family. Amazing food, definitely going to come here again. Everything on their menu is 100% plant based. Some legit Mexican vegan food.

Didn't get five stars because they were out of several things, one of them being the main thing we went there for... potato tacos. 

+ Tasty Vegan Mexican food, even my non-vegan sister loved it.
+ Tostadas were my absolute favorite thing
+ They were super busy, which is good and the guy who took our order was super friendly and helpful. 
+ Wait time was minimal 

- They were out of a the potato tacos, booo
- Not a ton of seating inside

Quickies:
* The red sauce is HOT
* Order potato tacos, everyone I know raves about them
* Mushroom option tasted way better than any fake meat option IMO


This is my new go-to Mexican food spot for sure. It's not super healthy but once in a while, when that craving kicks in, this is the perfect place to go to.

delicious. i ate way too much.
The order of fries was so big haha 
I seriously ate over half though along with two tacos. I feel like everything on the menu is extremely delicious. Can't wait to come back.
Worst on to go orders take like 20 minutes on my order sorry guys the place is busy but that killed

this place was pretty good! i ordered the supreme fries, and my friend ordered the classic nachos. they both claimed to have nacho cheese on the menu and mine was evidently there but my friend's had none on it. we told the lady working there and she looked confused and gave us daiya white shredded cheese instead, so i really think they just forgot to put in on. both of us got the vegan carne asada atop our meals and it didn't look or feel like carne asada but it tasted good. it looked like ground beef that was cooked without seasoning. the nacho cheese consistency isn't close to the taste or texture of real nacho cheese but hey, that's a hard thing to make vegan! i want to return for taco tuesday so i can try another kind of meat :)

I was visiting Las Vegas and planned to eat at my usual vegan places, but I was excited to find this place. I first tried 5 different street tacos with each of the 4 different vegan meats and the mushroom one. They were all delicious with Asada being my favorite. Over several days I also had burrito and enchilada combos. On the last day I went in the morning and had the breakfast burrito and it was amazing! They have green and red sauce which are both great, but I preferred the red sauce since it was spicier. I wish there was one of these near me in LA, but until then, this is my go to restaurant in LV!
Finally an authentic Vegan Mexican Restaurant, tried it for the First time it was delicious

I love this place! Great food and great friendly service! I brought my meat lover friend my 2nd visit and he even loved it! Gotta get back soon!  Tips for pancho: advertise more! Get your name up on that lame sign for the shopping center (I don't think I saw it on there?).
The burrito was okay but the 3 potato tacos and supreme fries were really disappointing
Best Vegan Meal Ever. I was referred there by my sister. It was amazing. the chorizo is amazing

Vegan junk food.

I would personally rate the food a two star but the service and concept deserves a five star!

This is not gourmet vegan mex. I would compare it to the omnis version of a "Robertos" type place. Junk food.

100% vegan. Grub Hub and Uber Eats.

We tried a variety of items most of which have Daiya :( cheese. But I can overlook that because we completely forgot to request minus. *punches self in face*

Chorizo Quesadilla- not sure what we were thinking ordering this, the chorizo was yum but we couldn't get past the Daiya goo factor. It was warm yet had that outer crispiness, prepared perfectly.

Wet Burrito-best item we ordered, huge a filled with yumminess we opted for Ascada and glad we did.

Potato rolled tacos- fried and crisp these were super yum but of course they are fried. The white looking lettuce and mayo globs were a shock and total taste turnoff but the fresh sliced avocado on top made up for the goo globs.

Nachos Al Pastor-covered and piled high these had amazing flavor. The meat choice I picked was a great decision. Once again I should have opted minus the Daiya shreds goo and the glowing bright white lettuce.

The hibiscus water is soooo yummy. Its NOT sweet and the tart taste goes perfect with the food. Wish I opted to try the Horchata but neither hubs nor I like cinnamon nor care for sweet stuff.

All and all the food is fast food, I'm willing to try other items like the tacos....but we do not like corn tortillas and wish they would opt for greener lettuce and less processed products. 

Better than Taco Bell, def not health food, yet cruelty free compassion based grub. Support local business. 

Just A-Ok.

My co-worker had been raving about this place for months. Unfortunately, I live in Aliante, and they were located on the other side of town. Imagine how happy I was to see their food truck parked outside of the Natural Grocers store right in MY neighborhood! They said they were going to be there every weekend (except for First Fridays)!  I had the 3 street tacos, and I tried 1 of each flavor. OMG SO AMAZING!!!  The flavor is so authentic, you forget that it's 100% vegan! I became a vegan about 8 months ago, and I have had so much fun discovering all kinds of incredible, healthy food. Pancho's is hands down my favorite when it comes to Mexican food. I will be stopping by their food truck EVERY weekend!!!  Thanks so much for coming to my side of town!

Oh my gaaahh. This place is SO good. Finally made it here for a taco Tuesday and I'm beyond full. Cool stuff to note... they are remodeling the place. There is a new seating area and the old half of the place is seemingly being redone. They are proudly serving Jones Soda if you're a fan. Tried one for the sake of it and it was as I remembered! Another Interesting fact to note it that this location repeatedly has a health grade of A.  Which if you look up some of the other vegan eateries... they fluctuate. Not Pancho's! Come get your grub on. Something for everyone. Favorite is those street style tacos. Oh and you can get the special with three tacos and a drink or sub the drink for a 4th taco! Whaaa!?!?

Jesus Christ I want to like this place so bad! I keep coming back here trying to have a better experience but every single time I've ever been here they've messed something up. 


First of all let's address the elephant in the room. What is going on with the AC?! There is none! They told me "yeah unfortunately the owner of the building won't fix it". Then it sounds like it's time to find a new owner of a new building. I've literally ordered no onions every single time I've been here and every single time except for the last time they gave me onions. That doesn't mean they didn't mess up though. Wouldn't be Panchos without a screw up. I waited for damn near a half hour for some tacos to go! 

It just really bums me out. I've been to this restaurant four times now and this is my final time. The restaurant area looks very bad. The no AC just makes it even worse. They could at least paint the wall one color. It's a combination of multiple oranges where they painted over other things with the wrong color. The bathroom is the cleanest thing I've seen in this establishment and it's extremely clean.  I wish the rest of the restaurant reflected what the bathroom does which is typically the opposite of anywhere you go.

Such a great concept but what a crappy location and store in general.  The food is pretty good here but it's everything else that brings down the place. I figured maybe if I ordered to go this time I would be satisfied but no yet again it's something.
Best vegan Mexican food.  I highly recommend it.  The flavors are on point and the food is fresh.  I love the street tacos.

Absolutely amazing food! You will not know that's is not a regular Mexican restaurant. Vegan or not this is a must try. The food I ingredients were very fresh. The prices are more than fair! Can't say enough about this restaurant.
I wish I lived in Vegas, this place is very good! I'm not a vegan but love everything they offer here and it doesn't disappoint. Attached are the biggest nachos ever!!

Finally had he chance to try this place today and I am lovin it! The food was awesome. Had the chorizo nopales and chicken tacos and all three were good. We also had the chicken wet burrito and the nachos. All was excellent! I wish there were another location near me. Will be back!

Amazing vegan food! Even meat and dairy lovers will be amazed!! I get the supreme fries with chik-end (vegan chicken) every time and they are so so so good!! They have a different special every day of the week. Taco Tuesday being an obvious favorite. Everyone has to try this place at least once!

FOOD: All Vegan, all Mexican, all the time! They make their sauces (including a sour cream and fresh salsas) in house. The potato taquitos dorados are a good option for Vegan newbies, or their tacos. The "asada" is pretty good, will be trying the "al pastor" next. I was hoping to get a great grilled veggie burrito or even some veggie fajitas, but they don't seem to do that, which I found strange. I was thrilled to see quesadillas and nachos on the menu, but my "asada" quesadilla barely had anything in it. Vegan cheese can be a difficult transition though. Avocado was fresh but I'm perplexed as to why they only seem to have chopped iceberg lettuce and underripe tomatoes when their target audience is people who eat produce for half of their diet. Menu is extensive though, with other options including tamales, tortas, fideo soup, and sopes.

SERVICE: Not impressed with the female cashier. It's not obvious that you walk up to the bar to order since the register is smack-dab in the middle of the bar with chairs around it and tables blocking any reasonable area where patrons would line up. There's no signage and the menus are all over the tables, but there is no table service. Finally figured it out on my own since no one addressed me after I entered and stood around for a few minutes. Placed my order and the cashier had to double check with the kitchen for availability of every item, then asks multiple times if it's for here or to-go, making it an unnecessarily long process. No smiles, no friendliness, nothing that indicates she understands she's in a service position or representing a new business. Male staff was the exact opposite: friendly, engaging, knowledgeable, and helpful, even brought me out extra salsa.

LOCATION: Parking lot is small, which may be a problem as they get more popular. Interior is a ghastly orange color, no decor to speak of, and the microwave is right in plain sight of the customers. Random bottles of generic salsa are out on counter.  Would suggest moving the microwave and adding a salsa bar to improve the interior.  This is a neighborhood with several solid Mexican restaurants, I'd only pick this place if you're specifically wanting dishes with vegan cheese/meat options as there are better veggie burritos nearby.
Literally my favorite vegan restaurant in Vegas! The supreme fries with asada are my favorite. Staff is very friendly and hard working i can't express how much i love this place!

I love this place!!! I order from here almost every Friday LOL.. The food is delicious & it's always fresh.. Only bad thing is that one of the employees seems to always be rude when placing orders by phone. Other than that no complaints.  the carne asada tacos are bomb as well as the supreme fries!!!

Found an all vegan taco shop, yes! I drove to Vegas to meet friends and stopped by here at the end of my drive before going to strip which has more limited vegan options. I ordered the Friday special, a burrito. It was a lot of beans and rice in a large tortilla. This definitely isn't healthy vegan food, it's comfort food and very hearty and filling. Also very simple, for my protein I got mushrooms and there was some lettuce and tomato but that was it. It ended up being two meals for me and I loved the tortilla. It's a very casual place, you order at the counter and there's cafeteria like seating. The mexican place next door has vegan options as well if you don't find something you want on the menu. It's located in a more run down area just off the strip at a major intersection so there's lots of traffic and congestion by the restaurant but for me it felt like it was worth the trip. It's also by the university so saw a lot of students dropping in. The other thing I love was how affordable the food was. You sometimes see someone add a vegan label and hike up the price even if you're getting something super simple but Panchos Vegan was very reasonably priced. I liked my food a lot, wish I had room for dessert. They had a huge menu and lots of different appetizers, entrees, protein options, desserts, and tacos. Would highly recommend for any vegans visiting Vegas. it is a little inconvenient if you don't have a car because you have to leave the strip but if you have time, I think it's worth the detour.

I'm stocked about finding this awesome place in my neighborhood!  They have a wonderful authentic Mexican food vegan menu. They are super busy,  which is a great sign! They even have vegan desserts.  Most importantly, the food soooooo delicious :) I'm in heaven:)

I am no vegan but my friend i was with wanted to try it... i have to say i was surprised it was good but wont go out of my way to eat there tho. Its just not my kind of food but it is good for all you vegans!
Sooooo good. Wish there was one in Los Angeles.  I'm sad I can only eat this once a year when I visit Las Vegas.

Disorganized, dirty dining area, you have to bus your own table. The food is decent except beans and rice, no flavor. The cashier is clueless. I ordered two combos! Thinking it included drinks, cuz when you order a combo.....well, it comes with a drink! When I got my order I got no drinks, I asked for one. The cashier had the audacity to come over and charge me for a drink when I was short another! :(  no receipt, no order number. I was as lost as a hooker in a library. Anyway continue going to Roberto's and please cancel your plans to open a second location.

Let me first off say I'm not a vegan. The food here is delicious. Secondly I'd like to say, I'm usually not even keen on vegan food. The food here is delicious! 

This is food that is done right and fresh. I wish tacos like this were available everywhere vegan or not. The spices on the different "meat" mixes of the various tacos really make it something special. I imagine this place will be blowing up very soon adding loads of locations. The world is waiting!

This place never sees to disappoint, every time I come out to vegas it's a must coming out to eat at this restaurant. I decided to try out their nachos as well as their burritos for the first time and it was all just beyond amazing.. I'm such a happy camper every time I come out here it feels as though I'm in vegan paradise :)
Torta tasted like real meat. Seasoning was on point. Haven't tried everything but so far all has been good. Can't wait to try the tamales but they're always sold out.

Went there yesterday by myself for a quick meal after work. I had the Chile Rellano because I've missed them since going Vegan. Omg the best I've had! They were amazing. I will definitely go back and tell everyone I know.

I had been wanting to check this place out for a while now, and had been telling my mom about it. My mother being Mexican cooks 100% authentic Mexican food but of course it wasn't vegan so she was curious to try it out! We decided to go this past Wednesday and walked in not knowing what to expect! The man that was behind the counter was very friendly and explained all the food to us, we don't know if he is the owner or employee but he was very nice! The place was pretty busy taking orders for dine-in and orders to go! We decided to try the pozole with nopales, the sope with asada and the three tacos special, one with asada, al pastor and chicken! Everything was so good and had flavor!! I will definitely be back to try the rest of the menu
Finally made it in after weeks of anticipation, brought a crew, ordered tons of stuff, tried it all and Pancho's is the bomb!  Great spot for sure!

It's a Mexican vegans dream. Ordered the wet burrito with imitation carne asada meat. It had green salsa, almost nothing spicy, had the best spices and taste to it. Need to check this place out! Prices are worth it for portion sizes!!

The Cactus rellenos were delicious. We were there at 3 pm on a weekday and there was no lack of customers. Very friendly fast service and great prices. I'm not vegan but my friend is and I picked the place mainly because it was close to where we were. What a great experience. My only ding was that my food came out almost five minutes before my friends did. I did not think this was enough to take a star away since the place was truly amazing.

So my fiancé and I tried a few things from their menu.
Asada tacos- they were good wish the meat would be more crispy. But overall good.

Fried rolled potato taco- I really enjoyed this and loved how it had sour cream, vegan cheese, pico de gallo, and shredded lettuce. Would definitely get again.

Posole- coming from a authentic Mexican culture it was very bland. Here is why I didn't give them a 5 star. I was very disappointed. 

Ham torta- very good! It wasn't just a plain torta. It had good flavor and fresh. I actually want to try the Cuban. 

Service: very nice and helpful towards the menu.  

Would I go again? Yes, try other things on the menu.
This place is bomb! The burrito is absolutely amazing! I want to eat everything on their menu!!!

Pancho's has become one of my favorites spots in Las Vegas! When I am in the area I make sure to stop by! Some of my favorites included the carne asada fries and potato rolled taquitos! So many great vegan options! I would recomendable this spot to everyone, vegan or not!

It had been at least 8 years since I had tacos al pastor so when I saw that there was a veggie friendly option I was so excited to try them! They did not disappoint. The horchata was great as well. The only thing missing is some guacamole. Service is friendly and the restaurant is clean. I will definitely be back again to try some of the other items on the menu.

2.5 to 3 stars for now, but I will give it another go. I really want to love this place. We have a vegan Mexican place by us in Cali that I was kind of comparing this with. The prices are GREAT here, especially considering this is a vegan joint. I plan to visit them again in the future to see if they have any improvements or new menu items. My rolled potato tacos were really, really lacking in filling. All I could tasted was the corn tortilla and a few bites didn't even have potato. I also didn't like the horchata. Too bland for my taste buds. The rice and beans are bomb. My vegan sister really loved the tacos. Order at the counter then go take a seat. Nice, friendly people.

So OK. It is Saturday around 5pm and we stopped in for a quick to go order.  Just 2 items.  The '"out of " board is ling, so I make a last minute adjustment in my
crave.  Still, 30 minute wait.  Are you kidding me?  This is not famous name LV strip restaurants.   The food is really good, not just good for vegan, but the service us worse than, well, pick your poison.  I'll only order from "delivery" options in the future and given the 30% or so up-charge, it certainly won't be often.  TOO BAD THEY HAVEN'T FIGURED OUT HOW TO SERVE PEAK TIMES.

Hey everybody!  Just in case you're thinking of going to Pancho's Vegan Tacos...don't!  They were recently shutdown due to a cockroach infestation, including roach feces in discarded condiment cups   I tried to warn potential customers, but my comment was promptly deleted and I was blocked from reviewing their page... More like Pancho's Dirty Tacoroaches  Even if they cleaned up after they were caught, the fact that they were willing to serve customers while fully aware of an army of battle roaches preparing for war drops their credibility to zero.    Video-- Start @ 2:20        https://youtu.be/BDP9VG06OFs

I just discovered this place today, May 1, 2018. Can't believe I haven't been here before or heard of this place before now. It was a little difficult to find at first since my GPS led me to another place as sometimes it does. There's another vegetarian place across from where this restaurant is but I had a feeling it wasn't the one since it wasn't called Pancho's vegan tacos. Anyway, I found it and boy am I glad I did. The man at the register who I believe may be the owner, was very friendly and helpful. He asked me if it was my first time there and when I told him it was, he showed me how to order. Since today was Tuesday, he informed me that it was taco Tuesday and that I could get three tacos and a drink for $5.14 with tax. I was so excited about the price and I definitely was excited that I could get a cantaloupe drink included with my meal for that price or an extra taco. I look forward to trying many more of their menu items! In my opinion the food was tasty and filling. Maybe for the guys they should opt for the extra taco instead of the drink. I meant to ask about the ice cream that I saw advertised online that's coming. I'm not sure if they already have it or when they'll have it but I look forward to that and many more meals here.

5 stars all the way to this place because we could not stop eating here when we were visiting. We came here 3 days in a row and could not stop everytime. 

Each time i went i got the cuban torta and oh my god cannot even explain how bomb is was. We also got the al pastor tacos and T H A T  M E A T  I S  T O  D I E  F O R. They put pineapple in it and it has to be one of the most perfect blends. We also got the arroz con leche and was hoping for that to be warm but nevertheless was still really good. 

So good that we have to take food for the drive back home and food for when we got home cause it was that good. We got the same cuban torta and al pastor tacos and a chocolate cake and that chocolate cake was one of the best chocolate cakes i have ever had in my life no joke.

This is the saddest excuse for vegan food I've ever had. If you want plain soy vegan "meat" with only lettuce tomato and beans, go here. This is the only review I have ever left and will ever leave because that's how bad it is.

I only have 3 tacos and a Jamaica.  The Jamaica was good, it's really hard to mess that up.  All of my vegan friends were right about the food, it's not all that. The tacos were ok.  The tortillas come from a bag I think?  Or at least the tortillas tasted like they were not handmade.  When I came into the taqueria there was no music playing and the customers had to talk low or whisper to each other because it was very easy to overhear or listen onto people's conversations.  The TV wasn't turned on either so it was awkwardly quiet.  Also, I had to clean my own table since either the business was short handed or they do not have someone to bus their tables?  Idk.  Every table was dirty, but I used a napkin to clean mine off.  Not very sanitary, but it is what it is.  The place was crowded which is good!  I'm glad a vegan business is making money.  But I can make better vegan tacos at home so I won't be back/:

I eat Mexican food but is not at the top of my list. But Pancho's has the best Mexican food. And vegan,can't believe it-sense i been vegan all I eat from Mexican restaurants is bean burritos when I'm lucky. Whole lot of Mexican restaurants fry the beans with manteca. Anyhow now every time we visit Vegas I'm eating here. Thank you guys for making this delicious food

OMG Absolutely incredible service, the owner is just down right warm and extremely welcoming. The food was......A..MA..ZINGG
This will be a weekly treat for me...
soooo amazing. brought my non vegan friend and she loved everything! service is great and place is clean. can't believe this place isn't busier. can't wait to come back!

I went there for late lunch and ordered one asada, one al pastor taco, asada sope and an horchata. The seitan for the asada is flavorful, however, the texture is too spongy for my taste.  The al pastor seitan had the same type of spongy texture as the asada, but this one lacked  flavor. I wouldn't order it again. 
 What I  was really pleased with  was the sope. The dough was not greasy, not undercooked, not too thick.  Also, the beans were on point, soft and had its own flavor. The sour cream didn't  really taste like anything and the shredded cheese looked more like mozzarella cheese  instead of queso fresco or cotija which is what it's  traditionally served with.
The horchata water was by far the only item you couldn't  that was vegan. It had that sweet and cinnamony taste that regular horchata has.
I knocked down 3 stars due to the following:

So, I left this place thinking about giving it 3 stars, maybe 4, maybe. However,  around dinner time I called in to place an order for a pick up. I knew they closed at 8:00 PM and it was 7:40 already which is why I called it in. A man answered the phone and when I asked him if I could place an order for a carry out, he paused and said " you wanna place an order right before we close?" Mind you, they still had another 20 minutes to go. How rude. I told him I knew that and would be there within 10 minutes. He then proceeded to take my order.

Also, the establishment seemed cleaned but it was extremely hot in there and when I arrived the cashier lady was all by herself at the front. She was taking orders, taking them out, cleaning tables. She was really hustling. And she (cashier/bus lady/server) told me  that the A/C wasn't working  properly so maybe I just went on the wrong day. No big deal. Regardless, the place is missing decorations. The walls seemed to have been painted recently  with a burnt orange color. And that's all that was done to it. Also, the chairs and tables are extremely worn down. 

This place has potential but lacks customer service, uniformity and the food needs improvement.

first of all the food is great and the prices  are great as well.  but dining in here is like eating at a run down taco shop. its worth the trip tho, if you don't mind wobbly tables mexican t.v. and an obnoxious older guy at the cash register with an outdated haircut.  hint; take it to go.

I have NOT gotten to try this restaurant yet...BUT I have gotten the chance to go to the truck at Natural Grocers on Fri Sat Sun! I am so happy they are here each weekend, everything we've tried is great! Thank you for coming to our side of town! Can't wait til you have a permanent place somewhere nearby!
Very good Mexican food wish this place was in California !!! Good people working there the tamales are really good I ordered some for my way back home! Tacos burritos drinks very good good !
OMG AMAZING FOOD MAKES ME WANT TO BE 100% VEGAN. Very popular place bc they were very busy when I was there but very nice staff

I am obsessed and addicted to Pancho's! The asada tacos and red chile tamale are my favorites. I eat here at least once a week. Truly delicious, and being meat free for 12+ years nothing has come close to this. Thank you for making great food at a great price. Taco Tuesday is basically a steal.
Great food! The service was great and the restaurant had a family feel to it. They were very creative making the food taste authentic and flavorful.

This is seriously one of my FAVORITE restaurants in Vegas. I stumbled upon it when my sister and I finished a movie at the dollar movie theatre. My sister and I have been strict vegetarians for the last 3 years and when I saw this restaurant I was SO excited because I rarely find vegan places outside of downtown. When I went in, the lady was SO sweet like seriously she seems like a genuinely nice person. When I saw the menu I was so overwhelmed because everything looked so delicious!! My dad loves authentic mexican food and we used to eat it a lot a veryyy long time ago. I was very excited to see that the menu looked just as authentic as a non-vegan restaurants. I ended up ordering asada tacos with a side of rice and beans because that was what I used to order. It was SO DELICIOUS like wow!!!! Seriously I couldn't eat enough!!!!! If I could come here everyday I would!

Today was mine and my boyfriend's first visit, and I was pleasantly surprised.  The cashier was rushed, because of orders,  but was still nice, the inside was very quaint, and I loved that they had choices with meat, because my boyfriend is a strict carnivore.  I'm only giving 4 stars, because the guacamole was to smooth, and someone got heavy with the lime on it, they didn't have diet soda, and my meal was good, but way to spicy, but other than that, I'd definitely recommend Pancho's Vegan Tacos,  because they show that Vegans eat more that salads,  and carrot sticks.
Best vegan tacos I've ever had!!!  The owner and employees are incredibly friendly and nice!

All I can say is HOLY SHHHHHHHH!! I just recently chose to become vegan. More like a challenge to myself. And omg! This place made me fall EVEN MORE IN LOVE!! Even my 13yr old daughter loves it! I'm definitely coming back? And the staff is great!

I have heard rave reviews from the people in my Las Vegas vegans group about ponchos vegan tacos. Today I made a special trip there because I couldn't wait any longer to try this. It was completely worth it, I'm very happy to say! From the moment I walked in I received such friendly and warm service ...not sure what the man's name was behind the counter, maybe he was the owner? Or just an awesome employee. Anyhow I told him it was my first time and he made some suggestions to which I chose the Cuban torta. He brought it out not long after, and it looked like a typical sandwich, one bite into it though and this was heaven! The bread was perfectly crisp yet soft inside, the produce was fresh and cold, the faux meats were tender -not rubbery -and flavorful enough. The avocado was perfectly ripe! And just the right right amount of onions to give it a little kick. 
I will definitely be making trips out here for ponchos vegan tacos again... And again!

This place was excellent, all around. They were out of a few things when we went, and that was disappointing, but they made up for it in service. They really seem to care about making customers happy. My meal and the meals of my 3 friends were all delicious! We will definitely be coming back.

Down right delicious food! Authentic and great portion size! We got the classic burrito with cactus. We skipped the vegan meats and cheese. Totally delicious! We went on Taco Tuesday and got the street tacos as well. They were so good! The sauces are very flavorful! 

Awesome customer service, clean, and very relaxed setting. Great place to brings kids.

First experience eating vegan Mexican food. This place is on point. I had the street tacos. You choose what type of "meat relapcement" you want for each, I got one of each that they had to offer and they were all delicious. Everything is seasoned well, including the rice and beans and I like spicy so their salsa satisfied me! The only reason I gave it 4 stars and it's no fault of the restaurant, there's not enough seating on a busy Saturday afternoon for lunch. We had to wait for people to leave so we could sit, so just be expecting that if you go during a peak time. I'll definitely be back.

I'm a food snob and this place is fabulous! From a meat eater's perspective, the meat substitutes and salsas are delicious and creative. I recommend this place whether you are vegan or not. This blows veg-nation away in every way! Start with the special  three tacos and choose different meats and get a free drink 6.99$
Absolutely amazing food! Slowly transitioning into a more Vegan diet and this place has helped with the change. Highly recommend their spicy ranchero fries!

As a Laco-Ovo Vegetarian, Vegan restaurants are a place where I can find a range of (hopefully well) thought-out entrees and sides instead of picking from one or two token dishes without meat or subbing something for something, hold the other thing. Most often, Vegan restaurant management is tuned into common food issues such as Gluten and Soy allergies and avoiding the GMO tell-tale High Fructose Corn Syrup by using Cane Sugar. 

This is not the case with Panchos. They have no Gluten Free options nor do they have any Meat Substitutes that are not Soy-based. If you are seeking Gluten-free or Soy-free, you will not find it at Panchos as of late May 2017.

While this may be no huge deal, there is a deal breaker for me. Panchos Vegan Tacos, a "MEXICAN RESTAURANT FOR VEGANS," DOES NOT OFFER GUACAMOLE. SRLSY. Yes, you read that correctly, a Vegan Taco Shop that does not offer Guacamole. Isn't this like reverse cultural appropriation or something, the withholding of the best part of their culture?

Now, if you had Panchos Carnivorous Currascaria maybe you could get away with it, because maybe Brazilians don't appreciate guac for the elixir of life that it is. But a taco shop without guac is like an airplane without  wings, a politician without lies, or a Filipino doctor on United Airlines, it just doesn't fly.

I see a new ad with a tostada that appears to have green goodness on it. Or at least it appears green, so maybe they took the feedback to heart and adjusted with the market, and if that becomes the case before I find out and update this review, then good on 'em for evolving their business. I intend to stop by in a few months when I'm out and about and hungry and have cash to eat out and see. 'Cause if there's guac I'll stay and eat the Soy and Gluten, nom nom, for I'm just a Laco-Ovo Vegetarian looking for a yummy Taco that has Guac!

FINALLY on my fifth year of being vegan I find the family-style Mexican flavors I grew up loving, without the lard, chicken broth, etc etc. Smothered burritos, carnitas, ceviche, quesadilla--I'll be back again and again.

There needs to be more places like this.  Portions are huge, food is very flavorful.

I had the Gran Torta and the Poole with "chicken".  Both were great.  I had to take the Posile home because it was too much food!

We arrived on an idle Wednesday afternoon around 4:00pm and the place was busy even though it wasn't lunch or dinner time.

Can easily recommend this place to anyone who like Mexican food whether the "think" they like vegan options or not.  And I'm a meat-eater.

UPDATE:  Been back several times.  This place is great.  Their enchiladas are wonderful.

First time trying Pancho's vegan tacos...OMG! Surreal! I didn't think it would taste like carne asada! Wow! I am definitely going back to try other items on the menu! Today was #TacoTuesday and they have great deals! You have to go! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
Sooooo yummy. In a weird part of town but it's worth the drive for sure. Healthy vegan food and it's cheap too!

This place is amazing I have tried the tostadas tortoise sopes nachos rolled potato tacos and some of the pastries that they have in there on occasions the service is excellent the people there are very friendly the employees are very very nice love this place

Eating here was my first time having vegan food. It was surprisingly good! Review would have received 3 stars but the asada they offered was so delicious I gave this place 4 stars. I wasn't a huge fan of the adobada. I would have offered 5 stars but the employee working the register didn't know the special that was offered on FB on the day we went. After discussing the special and showing the FB page my friend and I ordered separately. From the time she ordered to the time I ordered the employee forgot about the discount and charged me extra. Since the price wasn't that huge of a difference I didn't bother saying anything. That and it being super hot is why this place didn't receive a 5 star review. However, I would still come back and still recommend going here. :-)

Ok so I have had a couple tacos once from Pancho's that someone had brought into work. Today I stopped in and was blown away! I can't believe that whole menu is vegan!!!!! So awesome! Seriously... I came for street tacos and I ended up getting a combo and an extra one. The place was packed and it was so cool to see so many people eating plant based!!! Also, I am sure that my meat eating friends would enjoy!

I've been seeing so much talk about this place so I finally went on cinco de mayo. The food was great (we got a burrito mojado and enchiladas) but maybe it was a bad day to go. It was really busy so the owner seemed stressed so his customer service wasn't great. Actually really rude and snappy. I would return for the food but hope he's not there or in a better mood next time. For this reason I can't give all 5 stars.

I just recently went vegan and was looking at my map to find vegan places and found this little spot, and im so happy i did!! Their food is so good and totally authentic, id stop in here if you have time the employees are super nice as well!! Ill definitely be telling my vegan friends to hit up this spot!
Tonight was my first time there. I will be a regular from now on. The food and dessert was so delicious! They were very friendly and had affordable prices. I would recommend this place to everyone.

Cool little place off the strip. They prepare traditional looking and tasting Mexican dishes, all totally vegan. 
We tried posole, lentil soup, potato tacos and a bean and rice wet burrito. All using your choice of meat. I was quite surprised that they got the correct texture and taste of the meat. Meat choices include: asada, al pastor, chorizo, mushrooms and nopales. 
I think even meat eaters would enjoy this place whether they knew it was real meat or not. It's that good!

This is a very authentic Mexican restaurant but the best part is that it's all vegan! To the food and even the music that is played gives you all of the right vibes. The service was great; the employees were nice and very helpful. For first timers my boyfriend and I got supreme fries (which were recommended), 3 soft street tacos, a green and red tamale. The food was overall amazing! The red tamale really gave me childhood feels and the fries were delicious. If you want more than 2 Tacos get the combo because you get the perfect amount of rice and beans. FYI the rice is amazing, the bean needed a little bit of salt but still good. I 100% recommend everyone to eat here not just vegans. Anyone can enjoy this delicious place.
A pure Vegan land. Must try if you are nearby or in Las Vegas. They really know how to make vegan meals.

I always jave liked there food here & did tonight as well but their new diningroom dors not haver servers/waitstaff? I sat for about 10 mins before I asked & they said you have to order at the counter so I did. I like the big tv's in the dinning room but the ghetto music playing was too much. Luckily my kids are grown so I did not have to explain why the songs being played were using the bad N word & F this & F that. Front where you order is cluttered & not very clean throughout resturante. Easy fixes Pancho..
This place is disgusting!!!! Costumer service is terrible . They left my husband and me waiting to take the order. There was a lady who ignored us, so we left. Never come back again

Love it!!! It's so fresh and has a great taste . I live in Texas and we are missing places  like this in my area we have to drive far out. The owner and staff are amazing very informative and friendly. Will definitely return on my next visit. If you check in with Yelp you get 10%off. Combos come with drinks and prices are great!

There's some renovations going on at the moment, but all the food here is delicious! There's not very many "All Vegan" Mexican restaurants in Vegas (I don't think there's any, actually), so this is the best bet for some pretty authentic Mexican food. They also offer burgers (impossible burger and beyond meat burger). Staff is also very friendly... give it a few months to fully renovate and this will be one of the go-to Vegan spots to hit up!

THANK YOU FOR RUINING MY DINNER YET AGAIN. This is the second time we have ordered delivery from Pancho's and they screwed up the order. Then they don't answer their phone for an hour. It is ridiculous to pay for an order, a delivery fee, and tip and they forget part of your order. I will never order from Pancho's again. Worst Vegan Business ever.
Found this hidden gem on yelp and loved it. The portions are huge. I tried out the street tacos and the wet burrito both with asada. Delicious! Will definitely be going back.

I wish I could give this place more stars! My girlfriend and I went last night for dinner and it was better than what we could have expected! Got 2 of each taco and the asada was by far my favorite! She liked the mushroom but boring lol also got the nachos and they were delicious! Wish I could have gotten the arroz con leche because it's my favorite but they said it's made with almond milk, no can do with the nut milk:( vegan and not being able to do almond milk sucks! Well, we definitely will be coming back and I'm excited to try the tamales and enchiladas! Can't wait for a location to come to the west side!
Probably the slowest service I can remember.  Very plain inside and obviously a tiny kitchen.  The food is fair but don't go in you are in a rush.

First off it's always nice to see places that cater to us vegetarian/vegan eaters. Great customer service, always made sure we were taken care of. Food was amazing and fresh. I tried all of the street tacos and the supreme fries. Sorry no pics because I was too busy eating.

Really great food off the beaten path. Perfect if you're a local. If I lived there I would be eating here all the time with my Vegan Foodie Friends. Don't bring a non-Vegan with you though. My meat eating friend who thinks Tommie's is a delicacy was a complete stick in the mud here. 

I ate three mini street tacos and had a horchata and loved it.  I will be back again.

Absolutely delicious !!!

Every thing in the delivery bag was amazing !! 
Everything ! The salsa's green & red were fresh & delicious, the cheese on top of the tacos I really liked too ( idk what kind it was but really liked) my potatoes were seasoned nicely and the crunchy taco was fresh ! 

Love love pleasantly surprised that every item was satisfying to me & my non vegan mom!!
Came for lunch and the place was packed. The owner was alone working FOH. Took about 25-30 min for my carne asada burrito. They have daily specials. Overall food was legit AF. Will come back again

I first tried Pancho's after numerous co-workers swore up and down about how delicious this vegan food is. As I just recently started cutting meat/animal products out of my diet i figured I'd give Pancho's a try. I ordered an Asada burrito to go. Holy smokes!  The burritos are not only huge but tasty as well. I ended up having 1/2 for lunch and finished the other 1/2 for dinner. 
My next visit I ordered the dorrados (potato tacos) with rice and beans. Everything was seasoned and full of flavor. Definitely a yummy choice.
My subsequent visits resulted in orders of Pastor nachos with nacho cheese instead of shredded, and asada street tacos. Everything I've ordered has been delicious and I definitely don't feel like I'm missing out on not having meat. 
Since the recent expansion and addition of a second register, ordering to go has been so easy. In fact maybe too easy as I've been to Pancho's 7? times in the last month and a half and today was recognized by the guy who normally runs the register.  I think I've become a regular...lol. It's conveniently located down the street from my workplace and so easy to pick up lunch when I've forgotten to bring mine from home.
Sooo good!! Try the ceviche tostada. It was the best thing! We had some of everything on the menu. Portions are huge and the employees have an awesome vibe. We went back twice while in town.
Been here a couple of times. I have liked all their food. The pozole, burritos, tamales, supreme fries, and cakes are all delicious
The only thing I hate is I don't live closer!!!! Delish!  I love the street tacos and their hot sauces are Awesome
I am addicted to The tamales !!!!! They are so incredibly delicious it's ridiculous!!! Portions are huge here as well and definitely get your money worth!!

My family is from Jalisco, México and my grandma makes the best Mexican food I've ever had. Being vegan has been hard because I haven't been able to eat my childhood favorites, until I went to Panchos Vegan Tacos. Their POZOLE is INCREDIBLE. The tacos and tamales were just as good as what I grew up with. We stopped on our way in and out of Vegas and will come back whenever we visit. 

Hoping to see the franchise come to the Northern Bay Area !! Keep making delicious authentic Mexican/Vegan food!

First time here and it definitely won't be the last. My wife and I got a wet burrito and a burger respectively and oh my gosh, they were amazing. Bringing my whole family here over the weekend and I suggest you do the same.

My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try some vegan Mexican food and this place recently popped up on the east side. We loved it! Nice service, very fast food, and a lot for the price. He had the burrito combo and I had the quesadillas. Everything was very satisfying and we want to come back to try the rest of the menu
Best. Vegan. Mexican. Ever. If you like spicy, definitely get the wet burrito with green sauce. You will not be disappointed. Love the food, can't wait for the expansion!

Food is great, nothing spectacular but semi delicious. I stopped going here because the employees are completely rude. The lady Who is almost always there (older, glasses, shoulder length brown  hair) acts like she's on drugs or something. Ive probably ate here 10-15 times, and the ONE time I do end up complaining about my slimy cold cactus sandwich she accused me of trying to get free food as she twitched her head and body all weird while talking...."Well why didn't you come up and complain sooner? Where is your receipt?!" Ummm seriously? I ate not even a 1/3 of the sandwich, that's about how long it took for me to be entirely GROSSED out. She gave me my money back which was in her best interest. Also, the owner works the register a lot, he's impatient, antsy, and takes your order super speedy like you're taking up his time or something. These people are just always aggravated. They need to learn how to at least be polite, and pay attention to the food that's being served to the PAYING RETURNING CUSTOMERS!

Well I attempted to eat here and use the cool 10% off coupon Yelp gave out for checking in however, after standing at the counter not being addressed by any of the workers, I sat down in the dining room.  Workers were serving other customers and didn't even say hello to me.  So after 5 min standing at the counter and 5 min sitting in the dining room it was apparent this was an attempt in futility.  I did get a good look at the menu though.   It really irks me though I drove across town just to hit this spot as it's vegan and it was a waste of time, gas and energy.  So disappointed as I really wanted this to be good. I left irritated, and hungry.  I'll make the 30 min drive back home and make my own dang tacos.

The first time I had Pancho's Tacos was at a food feast on Fremont Street. I was so impressed by the taste of the tacos I had to visit them at there restaurant on Pecos. The cashier was very friendly and we received our food quickly. We went in around 11:30 am on a Wednesday. The tacos were so tasty! Best tacos I've ever had. Hands down. I had tacos al pastor and my husband got tacos de asada. We were both very satisfied with them. We will be returning very soon. When we left the cashier told us to have a nice day. Good service. Good food.
For someone that is not a vegan, I was thoroughly impressed!  From the service to the food, 5 stars!

After a very positive first visit, my husband and I decided to take the drive down for lunch here. The woman who served our food, seems to be the manager or something, was extremely rude. She dropped our food and started walking away in the middle of me asking her for something. She then proceeded to yell to me from across the dining area because she couldn't be bothered to listen when I was addressing her. Then, while beginning to eat my nachos, I realize that they forgot my "meat" and had to again go up and ask for something else. My husband got the supreme fries, aka cold fries drowned in toppings. 

Overall, I am HIGHLY disappointed waisting a 30 min drive to go to a place that couldn't care less about customer service at all. This will be my last visit to this establishment. Too much competition in Las Vegas to treat your customers like crap. 

Oh, and you have to give tip before receiving their raving services so beware.

Ain't gonna lie...this Authentic Vegan Mexican food is delicious...goodness gracious,if your Vegan and want some good Mexican cuisine Pancho's will be your best friend...even if your not Vegan still check it out...awesome service,the owner is very knowledgeable and helpful...the reasoning for the 4 stars and not five,is that I think Pancho put a playa on the porcelain in the potty room or maybe it was just my guts speaking tongues to me...not sure what it was but I can't rule it out,and that's the reason for the 4 star...I won't say what I ate,because my tummy may be different from yours...and yes I am going to go back and eat...it was so good I might order the same dishes.

If you love Mexican food you will love this Vegan Mexican place, so delicious!! They have various protein options but I recommend the "Assad" meat substitute. It's so tasty and delicious. I've only had the mole enchiladas, tacos and burritos and they were all delicious. They have a pretty big menu for a Vegan place and they basically have vegan options for all your favorite Mexican dishes.

Let me start off by saying I'm not a vegan but Pancho's offers the best tacos in the city period! The fact that it is 100% vegan is just a perk & super impressive. The flavors and textures are perfect and I couldn't believe I was not eating actual meat or cheese. I'm looking forward to dining here again so I can try the burgers everyone is raving about. I think Pancho's might convert this meat-eater after all. So whether you are Vegan or not I promise you will enjoy eating here. :-)

This vegan spot very much lives up to authentic Mexican taste. Only regret I made was getting asada(fake) never tried fake meat before and it just wasn't my thing. Wish they had a place in California so I can sample more items.
So excited for vegan Mexican food! The enchiladas with red sauce were delicious. Can't wait to go back and try more things.

Like a vegan Roberto's. But honestly, I like it wayyy more than I used to like Roberto's. The tacos are delicious, quesadillas are great, and my favorite is the fries with everything on it(idk what they were called). So yummy. They have great vegan meat or you can just add mushrooms if you're not into that. Love this place!

Our new favorite restaurant!! There are so many choices and everything is 100% vegan 
I have tried the burrito with mushrooms and the fries with "asada". Their vegan nacho cheese is TO DIE FOR. The portions are very large for the price. We have been thoroughly impressed both times we've come in. They are renovating right now and also have been out of a few things both times we've come. The food is so good though it hardly even matters. They also have Jones soda on tap!!

I'm not vegan at all but my bff is and man their posole was on point! Their chick-end enchiladas were amazing. Their cheese and jalapeno tamales were super tasty. We had chick-end supreme nachos too and they were delicious. There was a mix up with the charges and I emailed them and within two days everything was straightened out also. We will definitely be coming back!

I ordered the mole enchiladas, pozole, and rolled potato tacos. Pozole was good, not out of this world good but ok, got it with the chick-end. The mole enchiladas I ordered with the chick-end as well, mole was ok in taste but was waaay too thick, almost like a paste. The potato tacos were very very yummy, but honestly never ordered any potato tacos that weren't... you can never go wrong with that. So food quality I'd say 3.5 stars. I took off another star for the terrible customer service. The guy taking the orders (older guy in his 40's) in the front was arrogant and rude. Seemed annoyed that a customer came in, acted like he was super busy and the place was pretty empty. I asked which meat he'd recommend for the pozole and he looked so annoyed and said "I really don't know, whatever you feel like", was very unfriendly and snappy. I also witnessed a Uber Eats guy come in and was told they were out of the horchata which had been ordered... It was 4 pm how do you run out of such popular drink at that time of the day? Also, why allow the order to be placed for an item you don't have? Then, another lady came in a little after us and ordered a burger. Minutes later they came out and told her they were out of buns that they would have to make it with regular sandwich bread. Wtf? Oh, and I forgot to mention that I noticed my mole being heated in the microwave, not sure if that is the reason why it was so thick. But honestly, I'll stick with my vegan restaurants here in California. Maybe next time I'm in Vegas I'll find a good quality Vegan place that treats customers nicely.

Ridiculous good 
Came to vegas for weekend and we ate here twice its
THAT GOOD!! 
Pastor was oooooooooweeeeeeeee! Delicious
Torta its like being in mexico can say anything Bad.
Actually the only thing i dont like is that there not in
 los angeles
Absolutely delicious, authentic Mexican food. Can barely tell it's vegan. Prices are good, and portions are huge. My family and I will be back....try the pastor torta!

Amazing. I really loved everything about this spot. The food was really good and tasted authentic. The vibes are super casual and the staff is friendly. I had to come here twice during my weekend stay in Vegas because it was so good! It seemed pretty popular, there wasn't any tables available when I arrived on a Sunday afternoon, so I was just going to take my food to go, but a table opened up before my order was ready. I can't wait to go back the next time I'm in town.

I don't know where to start - EVERYTHING on the menu is exceptional. The white "cheese" sauce makes every dish phenomenal. The potato fried rollup tacos are fantastic as well as the tostadas, wet burritos and nachos. I wish Postmates delivered to Henderson!

After eating this quite a handful of times (through postmates) I'm just gonna give it a 5 stars despite of never getting my horchata or order 100% right. The fact that they now have beyond meat & impossible meat burgers is such a huge hit. I just need to stop by one of these days & actually eat at the restaurant. I saw on their Instagram that they sometimes have pan dulce

I've been to Pancho's about 4 or so times now and it never disappoints. I am always hesitant about Mexican food because it tends to make me sick.. but Not here!

The tacos are the perfect size and I love to come here for the Taco Tuesday deal when I can. The soy chorizo is probably my favorite, and so much tastier than actual chorizo. 

The fries are MASSIVE!! I've tried both kinds twice and each time we haven't been able to finish even half of them. But so good. The cheese is delicious. Again I try to stay away from dairy because it makes me sick but Pancho's cheese just has such a great taste and doesn't make you feel bloated.

This place is VERY tiny so be prepared for that! Ive has a time where we had to wait around for seats. The staff is super quick, and even when the place is packed they work hard to get you your food quick. 

All in all this is a great place and the food outways anything to keep me coming back!

Heaven, vegan Mexican heaven. 

I simply cannot understand with food this grubby, saucy, and filling, why oh why oh why can people not stop with the eating of flesh???? 

Soyrizo tacos were amazing. Wet burrito with soyrizo, amazing. 

I moved from Portland and miss my local mexi place that had soyrizo tacos/burritos.....

Was incredibly happy to find this on vacation in Vegas!!!

Bring your meat eating pals here, buy them a soyrizo taco and show them they will lack NOTHING in taste. 

Racism, sexism, speciesism. 

It's time people.
I love this place soooooooooOooOoOoOoOoOoOooOOoOo much thank u for giving vegas vegan tacos and asada fries

I really wanted to love this, but I will have to give it three stars, and I may be a little generous. The restaurant itself was clean and didn't have loud annoying music blaring, I got my order to go and that is where the problems started. I ordered dinner for myself and my husband, along with dessert. I was unable to eat the dessert because it was just way to sweet. I like sweet things, but this was just too sugary. The cake seemed a little hard, so I don't think it was fresh baked. The only flavor I could get out of it was "sweet". The rolled tacos were okay, they were filled with potato, which I knew before ordering, but there was just not enough flavor to them. Included in the take out bag was two small containers of sauce. The red one was very hot, but kind of tasteless and the green one was very mild and also tasteless. The tacos were crispy, but that is all I could really say for them. The rice had no flavor either, it really needed some spices and maybe some chopped green onions or something in it to make it flavorful. I don't know for sure, but I don't think the rice was very fresh either. The beans also were not flavorful, I was so disappointed! I tasted my husbands burrito (get your mind out of the gutter!!!), and it was the tastiest thing we ordered, but still not that great, it was filled with the same rice that was served on the side. 

The worst part of this whole thing (PLEASE TAKE NOTE FOLKS WHO ORDER THEIR FOOD TO GO) is the boxes they put the food in are not at all sturdy. They put the boxes in a bag that is just big enough to fit. When I tried taking out the first big box, the contents ended up in the bag. I appreciate the fact that the boxes are good for the environment, but I wish they would have told me to just rip the bag open to get to the food. I highly advise doing that. 

I really wish it would have been more to my liking, but I make some scrumptious vegan Mexican food at home, and maybe I'm just spoiled. I am glad that they have a presence in Las Vegas and I'm glad that so many people love the place. I'm all for cruelty free businesses and although it is not for me, I hope they do well.

I stumbled upon this place when a flyer was placed in my windshield I've always wanted an all vegan Mexican food restaurant in vegas rather than traveling all the way to LA. I stopped by with my bff for lunch and give this place a try, while ordering i thought since I'm in a Mexican restaurant that (the cahier) she'll speak Spanish but nope she was quick to get a little defensive and said I don't speak Spanish (whooops my bad lady don't hate me) **RUDE**  anyway I ordered the tacos " 1 asada & 1 al pastor" sooo good just that the salsa was a little plain I'm Mexican we like our salsa spicy ASF lol and also ordered a torta cubana, now if you look at the menu it list all the ingredients/components to the "Torta Cubana" when it came to my table it was missing everything the menu listed, so I went up and ask the cashier if she got my order right you know just to make sure she if misunderstood me. Her reply was again rudely! "oh i don't know why the owners will list that or why that's even on the menu we don't do that" ok i replied "that's fine" but inner me was like WTF? (In my head) first of all don't put items in YOUR menu if they are not available hint: (scratch it off) anyway the plain torta was sooo good & I didn't take a picture of it but I'll come here again just next time I order I'll make sure to ask if the item is AVAILABLE before they say no to me.  Lol the place has a lot of potential but it seems a little sad like make it look Mexican with interior design where's the Mexican music you know make it look like I'm at home eating (give it a vibe) it was so quiet. I give 5 stars for your food but 4 for customer service. By the way let her know to practice her customer service skills.

Delicious!  Tons of menu options.  Non vegans will love it too!  Cheap prices.  Nachos were good. Wet burrito with the cactus was amazing!  They were busy both times I went but still fast and friendly service.  I'll be back for sure!
I ordered the breakfast tofu chorizo burrito and it was way to greasy I couldn't finish it i probably won't be going back there again :(
I've been here three times now and every time the food has been on point. So delicious. I get the street tacos with rice & beans. Very affordable. Vegan food never tasted so good

Pardon my French this place is BAD ASS! Hole in the wall style (feel free to wear your sweatpants) with amazing vegan grub. Bring your carnivorous friends and dare them to say they don't like it. 
The green sauce is unusually hotter than the red. No alcohol but a large drink selection. I'd give 10 stars if I could.

This place is delicious!  I love the vegan options, it's definitely worth trying.  Service is great and friendly.  I'll definitely come back.  

The stayed open past 8pm to cater to their last second customers, that's how you know these guys are good people.  

I'm full.

Had the wet asada burrito with green sauce and the lady had chicken enchiladas.

I have had pretty much everything on the menu here. My personal favorites are the veggie burger and the al pastor burrito. I usually go for a burrito on Fridays when they are cheap as heck. The burritos are also huge- like chipotle size. I don't know what kind of veggie burger they use but it's my favorite in Las Vegas.
OMG!  i have been waiting for vegan mexican forever!!!! i had the 3 street taco combo, it was DELISH!!!  Delivery through UberEats super fast.

THE FOOD IS AMAZING! 

The reason for 3 stars is due to the fact they never answer the phone. I have had this issue now 3x. They shouldn't advertise or have a pick up option if they can't even answer the phone to take the order said to be picked up.

Food is great here but it took almost 50 minutes to get my food. I had the 3 street tacos combo. There's no way it should take that long for 3 tacos small tacos. Meat,cilantro,onion, and tortillas. They need a better system. Spend my lunch hour waiting for what should have taken 10 min max!

I've been to Pancho's twice. The first time was incredible 
Their vegan enchiladas were outstanding. The second time, they weren't so good.

The service is average but despite hearing the restaurant was not clean and up kept I found it very clean.

One of my fave spots for vegan food. Their supreme fries are amazing! We also regularly get the 3 Taco combo and it is amazing as well. Definitely great flavors. I still want to try their pozole. 

We often order catering from there for events at work and people always excited about it. Their tamales verdes are amazing. When I have leftovers I pop it in the oven so it gets crispy like I put it on a comal!

It took me a few visits to try most of the menu and decide I love the huaraches with chicken the most. They recently added fideo soup and the more violently orange it is the more flavorful! I do wish they would have more art up on the walls and it would be great if they could offer fountain drinks and an unsweetened ice tea option. They have very affordable daily specials and great staff. The desserts sell out fast but they are really good!

This place is such a gem. I'm writing this in hopes more people see this place. 
This place is simple and to the point. No fancy decor needed. No fancy tables. Just normal dining because their food speaks for itself. Everything on their menu is 100% vegan down to the cheese. Every dish down to burritos is under $10. Vegan food can be expensive from time to time but not here.

I came in on taco Tuesday to find that 3 tacos and a drink is $4.25. How is that possible. It's like the best deal in town. I ordered a round wii my buddy and ended up getting up to order another round.

The owner it looked like, was very gracious when I complimented the food. 

If you want a awesome taco Tuesday deal, or great vegan Mexican food please come to panchos. I promise you'll love it. Did I mention my buddy isn't vegan and asked to go back next Tuesday ;)

Two stars for the vegan carne asada tacos, and the bland posole. Minus three stars for giving us cold and hard fries. We didn't even taste them cause they felt so stiff and decided to just leave the entire bowl of fries intact.

Such a great spot! My boyfriend does not like vegan food but I was able to convince him to come eat with me here and he fell in LOVE! He told me that he's been craving a good taco for weeks and was so surprised that a vegan taco from here more than satisfied he's craving! Gotta say that the sopes are heaven! Haven't had sopes in so long and I finally got the chance to enjoy delicious vegan Mexican food:) Cant wait to be back!

Vegan Mexican Food...not a new concept...but the folks here at Pancho's have made it an institution in Las Vegas. Honestly, I am not a huge fan of any kind of Mexican food especially since I became Vegan but the food here is very good, to say the least. I had the WET Burrito and I highly recommend it. They have daily specials which are a great value...one of them include TACO TUESDAYS of course where you get 3 STREET TACOS and a drink for under 5 bucks. I posted a picture with the daily specials please check it out and pay this establishment a visit...if you like Mexican food you won't regret it. Eat, Drink, and be Merry my, Friends!!!!

I liked the chicken street taco the best. Nacho cheese was a little bland and tasted like something I've made at home. Chips were store bought. Will be back for the street tacos and would like to try the rice and beans.

I had the classic nachos and the soft street tacos when I dined here. The presentation of the nachos was so appetizing that one of the patrons asked if they could take a picture of my food. Their portions are also very generous, especially for the price.

The only thing I disliked was that the ratio of nachos to toppings was not proportionate. If you're like me and you love your toppings, this may be a problem for you. I wish the classic nachos were served with queso instead of shredded cheese so it would be easier to get cheese on every bite. I also wish there was more than just a drizzle of sour cream on top and a dollop of guacamole because there's no way you could get more than just a few chips with sour cream and guac on them.

The street tacos tasted great, I have no complaints there. Next time I eat here I will probably be ordering more tacos instead of nachos. Overall, I think it's a nice place for vegan Mexican food.

Loooooved their tacos asada!  It's a decent size place and the service is really good, the food is served hot so be patient!  Nothing is precooked it all tastes fresh and make sure if you get a soda you ask to have the top popped off before leaving.  I definitely will return when back in Vegas.
This place is amazing! The staff is super friendly & the service is great! The food is incredible! I can't wait to come back!

Amazing food! My boyfriend and I tried Panchos on our trip to Vegas and were so impressed with all of the vegan options and how delicious everything was. The portions were huge and the prices were good. We even stopped by again on our way home, and would definitely go again next time we're in Vegas.

Best vegan Mexican food I have had, hands down. We were in town for a few days and ate here twice during our visit. We tried the el pastor street tacos, quesadillas and albóndigas, the flavors were all amazing! Will definitely be back the next time we are in Vegas.

One of the most difficult things for me transitioning into veganism is the thought of giving up my favorite Mexican foods. This place has completely assuaged that fear of never tasting asada, al pastor, and chorizo ever again. The flavors and textures are completely on point, I couldn't have asked for a better food experience. We also had a great service experience as well.

I got a northern Mexican sope al pastor, a taco de asada, and a wet burrito al pastor as well. The tacos are authentic street tacos, so all they have are the meat, cilantro, and onion, which worried me because so many meat substitutes are overcooked, but it was absolutely perfect. I would recommend everything that I ordered to anyone, vegan or not! :)
