Probably the best Mexican vegan food I have ever had. I lovvvved the tacos al pastor and tacos de asada. We also had a sope the al pastor and that was bomb. However, the chorizo was too bland. It wasn't good at all. Overall, I would definitely come again! I have to try the tamales (they were out of tamales by the time I got there). And food is cheap too! My boyfriend and I only spent $18 on a sope, quesadilla, 3 tacos and a drink.

Awesome authentic Mexican food, the street tacos and burritos are delicious. I live in Phoenix, and would eat here at least once a week if I lived in Phoenix. They offer a specials Tuesday-Sunday and Meatless Monday is 10% also they have a 10% off Yelp check in.

If you are vegan and enjoy eating vegan tacos, then you would certainly enjoy eating at Panchos Vegan tacos.  Panchos Vegan Tacos is located on the East side of Las Vegas inside the Tropicana Plaza. This taco joint does not only have tacos, but it has a variety of mexican food such as sopes, nachos, burritos etc; and they're all vegan. Panchos is a vegan restaurant that just opened up in the middle of 2017 and has been getting more popular as the population of vegan/ vegetarians has been growing overall too.
    Having vegan family members can make eating out hard to do, because there is not a lot of vegan options in Las Vegas. I have come across a bunch of vegan places which have only been burger joints. I am vegetarian so my options of eating out is not as difficult as it is for my mother.  There is currently only one Panchos Vegan Tacos in Las Vegas as it a little brand new. Panchos Vegan Tacos is like a Robertos but everything on their menus is all vegan. Their tacos are filled with vegan ground meat and topped with cilantro, pico de gallo, and green spicy salsa. Their sopes are also topped off with vegan meat, chopped lettuce and tomatoes and a vegan cream. 
    I came across this place on Mother's Day. On a special day like this I did not want to take my mother to eat at the same burger joint she always goes to. So when we came across Panchos Vegan Tacos we thought it would be gross because the menus online did not look satisfying and the photos that were posted did not look as great either. When arriving, the restaurant was packed, and the place looked very unorganized, they used one whole section of the restaurant for the employees and guest to order their food, and the other half of the restaurant had about 8 booths and 4 tables. This restaurant does feel crowded because you have the line of guests ordering and then the other half of the line is outside or in the dining room area.  
Although I had a first bad impression of this place, the employee greeted us and we told her that we were new to this place. Once we informed her of being new she explained the entire menu to us making things easier for us to explore the menu. Their food certainly surprised me and I was very surprised on how similar the street tacos from Panchos Vegan Tacos tasted like real street tacos.  My mother certainly enjoyed coming here as she told me how great the street tacos were too and how the sopes tasted just like the sopes she makes at home. This place does not only bring you great quality of food but it can also bring you back to home, because the foods have similar tastings to the original dishes. 
The pricing for each plate is very affordable and the highest I have seen on the menu was about ten dollars, and that was for a huge burrito. Eating out at a vegan restaurant can turn out to be very expensive because there is not a lot to begin with, making prices higher since it is a unique thing to have in the city . So far this place is great and affordable and you can take someone out to eat here for just about any event.
One thing that I loved about this restaurant is how pet friendly they are. I know that some people are not comfortable with having pets in the space that they are eating at, but this place surprised me because not only did the employees not mind but the guest at that time eating there did not mind also. This explains how good the environment here is and the atmosphere.Another thing I loved was the great service they provide, the employees did not mind taking the time to explain the entire menu to us and tell us how their dishes were done, I believe that's what helped us pick our dish because it gave us details of what we were going to be expecting. I recommend anyone who loves street tacos and mexican food overall to come visit Panchos Vegan Tacos. 
I was satisfied with this place and have already told others to come here and have received great feedback. A couple of feedbacks I have received were from people who were not vegan/ vegetarian and have told me that the food that they tried tasted better than a taco with real meat. I have also received feedback from someone who was encouraged to stop eating meat because it made her realize that she can still eat her favorite foods with no meats. I have received a lot of positive feedback about the dishes and feedback about encouraging some people to try out the vegan/ vegetarian lifestyle. I think it is amazing that a simple review like minds can change another person's mindset in the up most positive ways. My intentions of sharing this place with others was not to encourage others to go vegan but to tell those who are vegan/ vegetarian to try this mexican joint out.

Perhaps the most amazing taco experience I've had in my life. The spectacular service led to smiles all around, and a shared feeling of comfort and belonging you wouldn't find anywhere else. I'm thoroughly impressed with the food: both its quality and the way it's delivered. Huge shoutout to Rachelle and Chris, as they made my dining experience all the more pleasant. And of course, to Jerry, as he led me to feasting upon the most decadent and mouthwatering items on the menu. Highly recommend. I most definitely will be eating here again.
Love it! The food here comes close to my mom's cooking more than anywhere else. I've found my go-to Mexican restaurant. Guaranteed I will be coming back regularly.
Street tacos are amazing super friendly an awesome service was actually surprised how bomb nopale taco could be a must go promise you won't be disappointed

I wish I could give them 5 starts bc I come here so much and the food is so good. Also the expansion is awesome! BUT!!!!!! Their consistency and customer service is trash!!!! It's literally happened to me every time I come. I get myself my food and I get sides for my kids usually fries beans and rice sometimes the soup. And every single time they bring out my food first and by the time my kids food comes I'm done! I don't know about you but no parent wants to deal with their hungry kids be upset while waiting for their food. The best part is when they actually bring my kids sides they bring NO PLATES or FORKS!!!! I'm not sure if every time they forget or assume my kids will eat from the table and use their hands. When I ask them for these simple things I always get and attitude and have to wait even longer meanwhile I finished my food 10 minuets earlier. On to the next part they always forget some sort of food item wether the fries or the soup or another side they always forget!!!!!! Also I don't understand how hard it is to get someone water cups after hey asked more than once and again the attitude. Honestly little customer service things go a loooonnnggg way!!!!!

LITERALLY OBSESSED WITH PANCHO'S !!! 
I can eat here 2-3x a week, definitely did that one week lol. You can ever go wrong with their street tacos & tolled potato tacos. It's always going to either be good or amazing!! I've tried their Asada fries as well they are really good, the portion size for the fries and nachos are very filling.

I just recently found out about this jewel...thier super mex burrito with shredded beef is the bomb!!!!! The carne asada is jamming too. I haven't had anything from here that wasn't good. My granny who is very picky enjoyed her food as well. Their drinks are delicious too!

From start to finish I was satisfied. The service here is great also. The only draw back is parking. If you go during peak hours you might fund yourself circling around or parking far and walking. However I still find it worth it.

excellent authentic mexican food. amazing. i crave it everyday!!!!! ugh!

definitely the best thing in las vegas and probably best mexican place anywhere. not to mention vegan of course duh! there is large block lettering outside so you won't miss it!

we came here on our last day in vegas right when it opened at 10am and got the chilaquiles, red and green tamales, chickend and asada soft street tacos. 

be prepared to drink lots of water (if you're basic like me) bc the chilaquiles are quite spicy but absolutely addictive! god i dream about that dish. the rice and beans they came with help to quell the spice. the rice was really good too. 

loved both tacos, i think we liked the asada better. they are such a deal and typical tortilla size, so i would definitely get more than 2 if you're not getting anything else. 

i'll pass on the tamales, they don't always have em, but compared to the other stuff-- they were dry and a bit bland. of course they came with a red and green salsa but my mouth was already on fire so i just couldn't anymore. 

they were out of horchata but have a hibiscus tea drink and unsweetened (yay!) iced black tea. 

god i love this place.

friendly owner & service. they've only opened about a year ago. your food gets served to you and they were kind enough to fill our water bottles. 

we came on a friday morning so there were only about 2 others but one more came in. 

casual, fast food like ambiance. looks like they're doing construction to expand their space. 

petition to open one in la! please! i need pancho's!

if you live in la, it's worth it to drive a few hours and get pancho's. other good vegan spots around too. make it a vegan day trip!

ugh my mouth waters every time i think of this place. love that it's all vegan and mexican. yes!!!

don't forget to use the 10% check in! even though it's already cheap af. never enough deals.
This place has bomb vegan tacos. The flavors are very good just like the real thing. The place does needs a cosmetic remodel but the food is awesome and the service was good too!!

After following this restaurant on IG for over 1 year, I visited them ! About 2 months ago I visited the wrong Pancho's restaurant, with the intention to eat here ( I finally got to try it !) OMFG! Huge portions, delicious food and man that Horchata ! We ordered the pastor fries (the plate was huge and I can't even explain how delicious). We also got the mole enchiladas and wet chicken burrito. Although I'm coming from LA area, I will always stop by here while at Vegas. My carnivore family also ate and loved it ! Plenty of parking, customer restroom available and plenty of tables inside to dine in.
Excelente lugar para comer saludable sin extrañar los sabores originales de nuestros platillos favoritos, en hora buena para la comunidad vegana en las VegasNv.

Absolutely horrendous service. Health code violations everywhere. A full dirty bus tub sitting there directly by the door to walk in. All the tables were left dirty. They were out of everything we wanted to try. Tamales. All desserts. Horchatas.

Everyone was so incredibly rude. I was insulted. I regret giving them my money. We will never return. I will tell my friends not to come.

This is the worst service I have ever received at any restaurant.

This place is my go to spot for healthy eats near where I work.  I really like how fresh everything is. My favorite thing to get is their Mushroom Burrito with Pico inside. This pairs well with their green salsa. I've probably have gone here 1-2 a week for lunch since it's opened.

The food here is awesome but we couldn't dine in because the entire place reeked of Nair/beard removal cream/sulfur. The staff didn't apologize nor give reason for such a repugnant odor. If there's an issue with the building, they should close until it's fixed. If the issue came from a worker, they should probably be kept as far away from the building as possible.
The asada Tacos were really good, I also order the  Spicy ranchero fries  but the french fries were soggy. Definitely the tacos de asada and chicken are the BEST!

The food is very close to the "real" traditional food without any animal products. The taste is right on the money. I had the chile  relleno and classic nachos. My coworkers had: street asada tacos  and torta cubana. They really liked their food and they're not even vegan. I'm definitely going back to try the rest of the menu and I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone. I'm very happy they opened their doors and brought the flavor of Mexican food vegan style!!

Really disappointed :/ had the potato tacos and a carne asada burrito plus half a tamale. Tamale was very dry, the potato tacos were ok and the burrito was also okay. Not a lot of flavor. Don't think I will visit again.
Wasted my entire 30 minute Lunch Break waiting for 1 Burrito, at 7pm! Food is good but not worth the wait, when you gave no time to eat it!

I was in town for a few days in Vegas with my boyfriend and we stopped by here and everything was amazing. We came back twice that's how good it was, really recommend the potatoes tacos, sope de chorizo and tacos. I really wish they had a location in LA!! Please make my dreams come true and open one in LA!!! Authentic fresh vegan Mexican food at its best.

These are probably by far the best vegan tacos I've ever had. HIGHLY recommend the al pastor, my goodness it's good stuff  

On the other hand, the potato taco was so damn hard, the plastic fork they provided was a no go. But still a 5 star cause that's such a small issue 

Will come back again
Authentic, delicious, and unbeatable prices. I came in for the sopes $2.50 special and was beyond impressed. I even ordered more (the carne fries). Everything was flavorful and exciting.
Love the staff... Obsessed with the asada tacos so much I had to cut my grocery budget a bit so I could indulge here. Thank you guys!!!

Pretty dang good. I'm not a full on vegan, but I like to eat vegan food when I can! 
I ordered a carne asada burrito and boy was it good. I ordered delivery  through the yelp app  for the first time, which was so convenient. 

The consistency of the vegan carne asada itself didn't 100% represent itself like the real thing, it was more like crumbled taco beef, but I still really really enjoyed it. Ordered a little sour cream on the side which was great too!

I could eat here everyday! I have tried different dishes so i get to share with my friends on what to get, nothing has disappointed me so far. Tacos are great! Ham torta! Chile relleno! Tacos dorados! Cuban torta! Pozole! Mole enchiladas are my favorite and the sweet bread is really authentic to mexican sweet bread. Only thing i will suggest is making better and spicy salsas! I believe salsas are a great addition to the mexican food :)

I love this place! I eat (order out) here A LOT and I mean A LOT. I love the posole soup it's one of my favorite items on the menu ! And the tacos are always great! I love Mexican food and never thought I could eat it again after becoming a vegan but this place made my dreams a reality. I've shared this restaurant with many others that are still omnivores and they LOVE it. So thank you for creating a great restaurant everyone can enjoy! Will continue to be a loyal customer.

This place is always jumpin with a big blend of people. Doesn't look like a vegan restaurant by the looks of the people and the appearance of the food. I had Asada and al pastor tacos, and the melon Agua fresca. Highly recommend the drink which comes with their 4.50 taco Tuesday special.

I was very impressed to see a full vegan menu, but had to buy a little of everything to see if it was quality. I got the Tofu Scramble Burrito, Chick-end Sopes, Cheese Chili Rellenos, Al Pastor Posole, & the 3 Enchiladas (Nopales, Asada, Chick-end) with rice & beans.
Everything was well seasoned & they use Follow Your Heart cheese so the creamy melted Relleno was delicious. Their sauces are so good, especially the reddish orange one which has the perfect amount of spicy. The breakfast burrito was my favorite, well flavored, lots of avocado & a quality tortilla... there wasn't anything that I didn't like. The posole broth was delicious & perfect for the congestion I had going on. I'm looking forward to going back. It's a very friendly place with amazing customer service.

Authentic, delicious Mexican! My daughter and I had the three taco combo and tried the carne asada, chorizo and al pastor. We loved them all. They were all flavorful. We also shared the spicy supreme fries. Sinfully good! What a great find! Large portions and good prices. I highly recommend!

Sorry, this is a no from me.
I wanted to like, but I no like. Dirty dining area, tasteless food.
Sorry..

This has become my favorite place to eat. Sadly it's in Vegas and I live in LA. But while I was in Vegas I came here twice because the tacos were just that good. I got the carne asada and al pastor tacos and they were the best vegan tacos I have ever had. My boyfriend and I also shared the classic nachos and they were delicious! The guy at the register who I think was the owner was very friendly which made me love this place even more. I definitely recommend this place to both vegans and meat eaters

My daughters and I visited the taco stand outside natural grocers and the food was so so. A bit too pricey for the portion but the customer service we received was terrible. The old lady taking the orders made a BIG deal over my 9 year old grabbing a 10% off coupon said that it was one person (and we were 4 people) and made her put it back. The cook never gave me the salsas I asked for or even responded when I said thank you. He just set my order down on the counter and walked off. Never again will we be going back there coupon or not.

This is my first vegan spot I've ever eaten at ! Panchos has the best tacos ever !!!! Me and my husband decided to make there Tuesday tacos our date night . I very much suggest there el pastor . They could fix th wait time though ... one time we had to wait over 30 mins just for some fries and a piece of cake . But other than that there food is the bomb !

The service was great and the food was even better. I had been wanting vegan Mexican food for the longest and am so glad this place exists. The tacos were delicious and the sopes too! I loved the horchata and that it was made with almond milk. Must try the green sauce. Forever a customer and telling all my friends to try this place. Thank you guys so much for creating a whole restaurant that uses no animal products. Veganism is the way! #supportveganspots #savetheanimals

Went in for first time, everything was amazing.  We ordered a ton of food and were so happy with everything.  I had the al pastor torta and carne Asada taco, ALL VEGAN.  Great posole, rolled potato tacos.  Very helpful cheerfull staff, even the owner was sitting down.  Will definitely be back
Many more times to this amazing completely vegan Mexican restaurant !

Went back next day to entertain some family, and the food just seemed disappointing... it's incredibly incredibly
Bland, no seasoning, no depth, as a chef by profession these are things I look for.. when you ask for salt they give you little tiny packets and to season your food properly you're gonna need at least 8... all growing pain issues that can be fixed to make the place successful. Food inconsistent at the same time two days in a row .. wish the best though and hope they work these issues out and succeed.

Came to Las Vegas for the weekend and was looking for a good vegan restaurant. Found this place on Happy Cow and it definitely didn't disappoint. We got the classic burger, an asada street taco, an al pastor street taco, the posole, a potato taco, and the asada burrito. Everything was so amazing that when we took a bite we kept saying "mmm." It's not too far from the strip and the prices are decent. Definitely coming back next time we're in town. The only thing that could make this place better is if they didn't use styrofoam.

First Mexican vegan place I tried and I'm hooked.  This place is small and everytime I've gone lines were pretty long but definitely worth the wait. 
Cashiers weren't really knowledgeable about the food and had to go ask someone else about what they used in some of the items. 
But over all the food is amazing.  And they have daily specials which is a bonus for me. portions are large and prices are low.
I recommend the potatoe rolled tacos and the pozole with mushrooms. Oh and wait the nachos were freaking delicous!!
If your looking for a vegan place to try out, go to panchos vegan tacos you won't  be sorry.

I come here frequently lol. I just want to say I love everyone here. Staff is always friendly! Service is always fast! I love the new changes to the place itself. Food is awesome! I always recommend this place to friends who are vegan and non vegan because honestly anyone would love it. Great place overall :)
Didn't know vegan Mexican food can be this good. Try it, you will not be disappointed.

This place is great! Yummy food and healthier than eating meat. Notice that I did not claim that it's automatically healthy food, just that it's healthier than eating lots of red meat. And it's a definite bonus that the food tastes great. (And it is a bit healthier) And they have a great assortment of foods on the menu to choose from. The staff is super friendly and helpful and willing to walk new vegetarians or people who are just trying out the Weekday Vegetarian thing out for the first time through it. They have 6 different kinds of faux meat, and all of them are good. Try bringing some home to the nonvegan in your life- let them try it, ask them how they liked it, and THEN tell em it was vegan- they'll be shocked!

Wow, this was just what I needed. The food here is delicious and the prices are very reasonable especially for being vegan. I had been wanting some Mexican food other than fried potato tacos. Don't get me wrong, I appreciate that option at several local restaurants but Pancho's has a full menu.

I had the Chilaquiles with both green and red sauce and it was really good. I decided to add a full size taco and picked the mushroom as the "meat" and what a great choice. It was the best thing we ate. My wife who is NOT vegan loved the taco too. She ordered two potato tacos and was not expecting much but she came away really impressed. The chips and salsa were good too. We saw a couple of guys order the nacho plate, man it was huge. 

The place had a continuous flow. You walk up an order and they call you up. Place was really plain but nice and most importantly clean. Will come back when I am in town.
Not bad food but not the greatest either....They need more variety and a bigger space!! It was super cramped inside with bad seating...overall it was ok.
10/10 the best. I haven't had this good of Mexican food since I became vegan. Makes me forget that I actually am vegan.
This place is delicious and tastes so much like my Tia's cooking that I forgot it was vegan!!!

Interior look-Pancho Vegan Tacos are currently expanding. You may notice dim lighting and chairs stacked on one side of the room.

Customer Service- Excellent. Cashier well versed in their menu and very nice.

Wait time-10 minutes

Order placed- 4 Carne Tacos, 1 supreme nachos and one enchilada.

Food quality- excellent. Nachos were made with the highest ingredients. Chips were very stable after 15 minutes of eating. Tacos excellent and nutritious.

Vegan kid frendly- Yes. My 2 year old little girl eats vegan tacos without no problem. Vegan "meat" is very kind on 2 year old stomach and poop.

Prices- very good 

Will return

The food was so good I forgot I wasn't eating meat. The chorizo tacos tasted like the real deal! Also had the carne asada wet burrito and it was phenomenal! My boyfriend and I have been twice in the past two days. It's definitely a must have!

This place is on point! I'm from Southern California where we know Mexican food but also have a large vegan food industry. Panchos has all your Mexican favorite dishes BUT in a healthy plant based version.

This place is a gem! I'm not a fan of vegan food, and not a lover of Mexican food; but this place was phenomenal! 
It was fresh, it was tasty, and the prices were extremely reasonable! 
I will be back, since it's so close to campus!

If I could give this place more stars, I would. What an incredible meal! We had green enchiladas with chorizo, asada and Al Pastor tacos, and a gran torta all for under 30 bucks. Very impressed and we will most definitely be back!

I never thought I'd say this, but their vegan al pastor tacos are better than the al pastor at most traditional taco shops. Talk about seasoning! 

Pancho's is bringing affordable vegan food to the masses and what better way than by Mexican food! I've eaten here a handful of times and my food never disappoints. I have to admit I've had all of their meat and I'm sure you know my favorite is al pastor. I've had their tacos, burritos, quesadillas, and nachos. They also carry soup and tamales.

If you need a recommendation then definitely do the tacos or a quesadilla on corn tortilla. I feel like the burrito has way too much everything else in it and then the non-melted cheese on the nachos are a put off. The quesadillas with melted vegan cheese is amazing!

My only suggestion to get that last star is their customer service and the store cleanliness. I'm sure they run on a tight profit margin, but they need to step up their ordering system to be more organized. Also they could really spice up their beans and rice. Hate to admit but they are pretty bland. 

Definitely check out Pancho's to help save the earth. They have awesome weekly specials like taco Tuesday! Theirs includes three tacos and a drink for less than five bucks. It's very affordable and centrally located.
Excellent flavors, customer service, and ambience. Wish they would open more locations and expand!

WOW! Is all I can say to review this place. I came by accident. I initially wanted to go to Dunkin Donuts to order an ice coffee, but decided to bail when I saw the store Mexicali Raspados had Elote in a cup, something I had mentioned earlier that day, then my boyfriend parked in front of Pancho's and noticed it said "vegan tacos" with a wide-spread variety of other authentic Mexican food. Then I saw a lot of people coming in and out. It was full. I was curious and looked at the reviews on both yelp and google and both nearly 5 stars. I ordered two tacos of al pastor and I couldn't even notice the difference. If anything it tasted better since with no meat the food is based solely on flavor. This will be my go-to place from now on! The wait was about 15-20 mins for two tacos. I had the time so I couldn't complain, it was very much worth it to be honest.

Poncho's makes the best vegan tacos I've ever had. I ordered the street tacos and had chicken, asada, and mushroom. My favorite was the asada but all are so flavorful and for street tacos they were full, you definitely get your monies worth here. Great beans and rice as well. The overall presentation was lovely even on my to go order. I will come here again next time I'm in town.

This place is a gem! To be able to have vegan Mexican food, and it's good is a dream.  The staff is really friendly and the prices are amazing. I am obsessed with the pozole. They are finally expanding the restaurant and adding more seating. I wish they had one of these back when I lived in LA.

Wow, just wow. As a lifelong Mexican food eater from San Diego and full-blown anti-veg carnivore up until a few years ago, I can say that this place delivers like no other. It is real Mexican food--spot-on "meats" and sauces and sour cream--but 100% plants. The location, ambience, menu, and service is authentic hidden gem, strip-mall Mexican food, yet, dare I say it again, made from plants.

I sampled the potato rolled tacos (crispy and satisfying--I could have eaten 5), "cheese" and jalapeño tamale (very good without being dry), the "beef" tamale (also good, though I think I liked the jalapeño better because I like the little kick), and the wet burrito with both the red and green sauces (HUGE burrito with crumbled beef that is so "real," you'll be truly concerned that a mistake was made). I liked the green sauce a little more, but both sauces were perfect and I asked for another serving. I would legitimately buy those sauces and put them on everything.

My man sampled my plates and also had the "chicken" burrito--loved it all, couldn't believe the serving sizes, loved the sauces, and walked out stunned that we got our "dirty Mexican food" vegan style. "How did they make the rice vegan!? What sour cream is that!? Can you believe the menu!? Can we go back tomorrow!? That wasn't greasy and I don't feel gross--how is this happening!?" He's an Alberto's (Filibertos, etc.) guy and felt like, for the first time in around 6 years, that he got "his food" without compromising a thing. The boy was practically dancing in the streets. 

No way that anyone will think the food is vegan--everyone will like it. Flavorful, filling, messy, crunchy, saucy, awesome Mexican food without consuming/harming/using an animal. Just wow.
Love this place. The roles potato tacos were delicious! Everything tastes fresh and healthy!

It was our first time there. The food and the service was amazing. The interior of the building needed some work. The interior was in need of repairs such as paint, flooring and booth repair. There was some booths that actually had the back paneling missing and there was exposed wood. They just threw up a banner on the inside. Looks like they just set up shop in 20 mins and opened. If it had just a little better appeal, it would have been a 5 start as the food and service was outstanding.
Girlfriend loves them. Only complaint is the vegan cheese sauce on the nachos suck. Needs more nutritional yeast maybe some jalapeno and paprika etc. Over all a great place tho.
Food was bland and boring.  I was expecting a lot more based on these reviews.  If you want food that is anything but mild you will be disappointed.
Best place ever. Tortas are the bomb. Every time I come to Vegas I'll be back. Wish we had a restaurant like this in our town.
Never tried vegan tacos before, so I was excited to try. These are GREAT tacos! no matter if you're vegan or not. Will definitely comeback.

This place has a great staff, good service and excellent vegan food.  I still don't know how the sour cream is vegan made, but I will find out.  

The only disappointment was the lentil soup...just not up to par.  But the tacos are good and the tostada was great.  

It's very busy in the late afternoon so I think it's always busy.
The food was amazing , however I had to clean my own seat and counter which was kinda like wtf .. the guy handed me a rag to clean my own seat .
This place deserves 5 stars. The food is divine. I had the asada sopes and they were  beyond delicious. The bad part is that I live too far to come back.

The food was pretty good, especially the rice pudding and the horchata. wish i could try everything but i only was able to try the street tacos. all the street tacos were great ezcept i think the chorizo, it was ok but i was very oily and not too flavorful. but other than that this place is great!
Best vegan Mexican food in town hands down. The asada is soooo bomb. Service has really improved and majority of the staff is very friendly.

Food is maybe delicious, but the place itself is just not OK. Messy and looks cheap. No hot beverages. 
Probably the best thing about it is that this place is vegan, but more than that...would not recommend.
I'm not vegan.   But I wanted to try this place out & I loved it.  Friendly staff & food is tasty
I go eat there at least once a week. Love the food & the staff is great they are usually slammed because it's only two people working

Pancho's Vegan gets 5 stars from me...  I'll give 5 reasons for each star.  1.  It's crazy affordable.  You can walk in with $10 and eat a huge meal.  2.  It's amaaaaaazingly tasty - authentic Mexican.  3.  It's VEGAN!  The whole restaurant!!!  4.  It's right by UNLV, so very accessible for starving students like myself.  5.  The service is fantastic, and their restaurant itself is very roomy and casual.  Great for small and large groups.

I was pretty excited about this place coming home to vegas for a visit. I didn't know until AFTER I ate that they were on dirty dining for roaches. Eek! Luckily, I survived and enjoyed my meal in ignorance. I would have to say it was pretty good. It was like the Robertos of vegan restaurants and I'm sure most Robertos are probably teeming with roaches themselves. The rating I gave was partly for the awareness after the fact and feeling slightly disturbed by that, and for the service. The woman at the counter seemed super unenthusiastic and was not very attentive. The meal itself took a while and when it came out it was alright. I may give them a chance again in the future if they have a clean bill of health and maybe some friendlier faces inside.


So I ate here again when they were at the vegas veg fest and had a very good experience. The vegan carne Asana fries and horchata were delicious.

I'm glad the Las Vegas have a great Vegan Mexican food restaurant. I went for the first time during my visit and my mind was blown at how good the food was there. The flavors were very authentic and tasty. I had a wet burrito with green and red sauce. I also had the vegan carne asada fries and was stuff to the max. I'm looking forward to going back before I leave.

Excellent! We are newly vegan and completely enjoyed Pancho's! The food was amazing, flavorful and all vegan! I ordered "chicken" street tacos which were delicious and my husband had a "chicken" burrito, he loved it! It was worth the drive from Centennial Hills! I highly recommend!
Nice little place. They need to add more "meat" to the burritos or just start calling it a rice and bean burrito. Overall, the food is good.

I had the huarache with nopales and it was so good! I like that the bread was thin but not too thin, also the salsas were flavorful but not very spicy which I prefer. Nice humble family style restaurant feel.

Pancho's Vegan Tacos was the highlight of my Las Vegas trip!!! This food is delicious whether you are vegan or not!! I tried the posole, sopes, tostadas, and tacos. Their sopes were out of this world amazing! Everything was good, I think my least favorite thing was the chicken taco. I would come here again and again. 

Ordering: Before you sit down, you order your food and then you sit and wait for your food and drink.

I follow them on instagram and see that they sometimes have tamales and pan dulce. Unfortunately they did not have pan dulce when I was there. Maybe they can open a bakery down the road, that would be amazing! Thanks Pancho's Vegan Tacos for creating great vegan food!

Greeted upon walking in, place was extra clean and the workers were very helpful in terms of the selections on the menu. I was craving enchiladas and couldn't decide green sauce or red but little did I know they did half and half! The posole!!! That was the highlight of my meal. I've been searching for really good posole without the meat, I've even tried to make my own several times. Their posole was flavorful and just exactly what I was looking for. If you're ever craving authentic Mexican food vegan style this is the place to go! Loved it!
WOW!! One of the best vegan spots in town. The best part is the prices are amazing because the portions are HUGE similar to a non vegan Mexican restaurant!
The food was extraordinary! So yummy! Couldn't believe it was all Vegan! Omg and the strawberry cream cake was soooo good! Very friendly people and cute atmosphere. Defiantly coming back! Thank you!

Hole-in-the-wall place! I am NOT a vegan at all and don't plan to be one, but when I want to be supportive of my friends that are, I will go out of my way to do so; most times my vegan experiences are not very pleasant, but this time, they were able to turn one of my favorite fast food items into a vegan dish.

Now I know this is not something you should be doing to Mexican food, and I agree, but they somehow pulled it off. The carne asada and al pastor tacos tastes very similar to the real thing. I know people would still be able to taste the difference, but not on the long run. It is still very filling. I would reccomend.

I always say tradition is no excuse for unethical practices, but I am so damn glad there is a traditional Mexican Vegan spot in vegas now. Everything from the posole to the tamales are amazing. This just goes to show you don't have to give up tradition to go vegan. I agree with other posters that customer service is average however the food makes up for that ! Love, love, love ! Will be using them to cater in the future.
It's like a vegan Roberto's but way better what else is there to say, so good! "My review was too short so this is just extra."

This place is amazing! The food is delicious, and I really wish they would open a restaurant in Washington State. 

You can't really go wrong with anything on the menu, and the best part is that it's all vegan! They even sell vegan tamales, and there is usually a sign at the front telling you if they are sold out.

At first I couldn't tell if the servers came by to take your order, or if we had to order them sit down - you order then sit! 

They are very family friendly and have baby chairs that are clean.
The mushroom tacos with red sauce is so bomb! So flavorful! The lady upfront is super friendly!
Tried it for the fist time. So good! I am not even a Vegan! But if the food is always this good, I may covert! The  burrito with asada was delicious! Go try it out!

I was a little disappointed at the lack of flavor from this authentic 100% vegan Mexican spot. The beans were so bland and the asada too. I've been spoiled by the best vegan asada on the planet so I may be a but biased. I wanted to give them 4 stars but they only deserve 3.5 on the strength of the nopales and the chile relleno alone. The tamale wasn't exciting the salsas were lacking and the red sauce on the wet burrito couldn't even salvage the lack of flavor. The prices are good though and having vegan food is important but they need to up their game in the worst way.

Fail. I called to place an order and was put on hold. While on hold, I listened to the person who answered the phone take orders for other customers for about five minutes. I finally hung up and called back but never got through because they forgot about me and never hung up the phone. Lame.

My first time here  and it was amazing ! I first order one taco and one sope to try the food and it was PHENOMENAL ! it was so delicious so much flavor  I order more tacos to try the different vegan meats definitely will come back :D ! I'm very excited to see that they have posole which I will be trying in my next visit.

Food is delicious but they don't have a good phone ordering service, i was in a hurry because of my lunch time at work and i want it to place a pick up order to and they didn't answer the phone (i called several times), i was on my way already so i tough maybe ill be lucky and they wont have that much wait, but there food is really good soo they had line to order plus 15 min wait for the food so i couldn't stay and wait for it, is not the first time i try to set up a pick up order and this happened.
It will be great if they fix this and pay more attention to their online and phone orders since tacos are a practical thing to eat when you are in rush  FAST FOOD and will be a good idea to stay open later (like a regular taco place)

I'm new to vegan food so I don't have know whats excellent and not:)

I really like this place. I've been there 3 times so far. They are extremely nice and you get all walks of life. You place your order at the register and sit where ever you'd like while waiting for your food.The place is very clean. You can either eat there or take out. I assume it's a step above fast food

I've had the enchilada, torta, fries, nachos, potato taco, rice and beans so far. The fries with chorizo is my favorite so far. Second is the nachos with chick-end( I like there cheese sauce for it).Not a fan of he Daiya shredded cheese though.  

Overall I like it and will keep going back :)

UPDATE 3/9/18: this is by no means anything against the food, the food here is pretty good. The customer service from this company specially today was very poor! I was informed they were on dirty dining and because I made a comment on one of their Facebook post they felt the need to send me a private message being extremely defensive. After I readdressed this via their public post they continued to argue with me through their social media account. I just don't think that's something you do to a customer.... specially when the vegan community here in Las Vegas is very tight-knit.... not sure on how I feel about this, it's tough when you enjoy the food of a place but the service is not up to par.....


So I was surprised to see that a place would actually have authentic vegan tacos. The location of this place was a bit confusing but it's located by the Tropicana Cinema. The prices are very affordable there's a lot of choices with drink combos too. I stuck to the single authentic style tacos these are made out of seitan. I used to be a meat eater and tacos were some of three foods I missed the more THESE TACOS ARE SOOO GOOD you cannot tell the difference from real meat. My favorite would have to be the "chorizo" and the "alpastor". I also had he orchata but this was regular not too sweet. Definitely recommend this place it is very good!

I  not a Vegas person but I must say I was reluctant to try their tacos but once I did I was inlove with it! I couldn't believe vegan taco could taste so good! I would highly recommend to get their tacos! It's amazing! Omg I am now hungry for it!

I can't believe that there is a Mexican restaurant that is completely vegan! And on top of that, it's actually really, really good!

So I actually had this place bookmarked a few weeks ago since its not that far from where I live. I had looked at a few of the pictures and saw the 4.5 star ranking and figured any place with this many good reviews I need to try. I saw they had Vegan tacos but I assumed they just had a few items, not the whole menu. I'm not vegan, but I have recently been trying some vegan food in an attempt to eat healthier. I found the fact that this place is completely plant based to be a pleasant surprise.

So my wife and I ordered too much food as usual (thank you for to-go boxes) and were very happy with almost everything. We got the nachos with "asada", five different types of tacos, potato taquitos and a Cuban torta.

The nacho cheese sauce was fantastic and you couldn't tell it wasn't real cheese. We asked how it was made and told us it is made with potatoes, carrots and nutritional yeast, plus some secret ingredients. I would eat this over the usual neon yellow nacho cheese any day.

The torta was my favorite thing, and again I couldn't tell it wasn't real meat. It had "ham" and "turkey" and "hot dogs", along with tofu, avocado and "cheese". Though I wouldn't call this a Cuban, it was easily the equal of any other torta I have ever had.

The taquitos were one of only two things that weren't that great (I'll get to the other later). It's not that they were bad, it's just that they weren't as good as the other food we had. They potato didn't really stand out as a filler for the taquitos, but they were pretty decent after being dipped in salsa. If you are a person that likes taquitos more for the crunch of the fried tortilla than the meat inside you'll probably like these. I could see myself ordering them again if I was in the right mood.

For the tacos we got one "asada", one "pastor", one "chorizo", one "chicken" and one mushroom. The mushroom (the only one not trying to imitate meat), while far from traditional was delicious. Along with the mushroom we also loved the chorizo, which you couldn't tell wasn't real chorizo. The chicken was also very good and tasted like chicken, and the pastor could pass for pork but was a little to sweet for my taste. The only one we didn't really care for that much was the "asada". We also ordered the asada on our nachos and it was by far the least favorite "meat" we tried. It wasn't so much that it was bad, but it didn't taste anything like carne asada or beef in general for that matter. Its consistency was more like a sausage than steak, and it's probably the only thing we wouldn't get again.

There was also one additional meat, cactus, which we didn't try but I guess we will get that next time. I can't really hold the "asada" against them considering I have yet to find a vegan substitute for beef that actually taste like beef. I have now had vegan cheese, eggs, pork and chicken and loved each one, but I guess beef is much harder to pull off.

The prices were on par with any other Mexican place you'd go to, though I thought the torta for $10 was a little high, despite how good it was. The nachos on the other hand for $5, with the option to add meat for a $1, are a fantastic deal.

Even if your not vegan, but you enjoy Mexican food, I highly recommend coming here. If you are vegan then this place is a must.

Oh my goddddddd best vegan carne asada fries ever. I've had them like 4 times now. Thankfully they're right around the corner from my complex so I can order from them whenever I want. The food is super heavy but I assumed it would be before trying. I missed robertos carne asada fries so bad once I went vegan but now I found my replacement :)
I ordered through Postmates... my goal was to attempt to become vegan. They're good was amazing! So far everything I had was great and the "meat" tastes like chicken! Will be ordering more often!

The most amazing vegan Mexican food! So I've been vegan for approx 1 month. This place makes the journey so much easier. The flavor is amazing. The "Asada" was so flavorful. My husband was like "this isn't meat?!?" And he is a carnivore! The al pastor was tasty. The chicken was ok. Def will be going back for more asada! I wish they would open one of these in my area. Loved this place! They just need to step up their air conditioner game a little. It was pretty hot and stuffy. Oh and the green sauce is hot, even when they tell you it's mild!

I've had this place bookmarked for a bit and finally made it over to try, and I sure am glad that I did. 

I will mention, this is vegan, so you can't compare it to "real Mexican food" , it simply isn't comparing apples to apples.  No animals are harmed for your meal here. !

I will say that I was impressed by the food. I ordered the burrito with "asada". It was flavorful and it was a pretty big burrito. 

The staff was friendly and the dine in area was clean. 

I will definitely be back to try something else on the menu. The fries looked amazing so I will have to try those next.
The food was so flavorful and authentic, I had tears in my eyes while eating the asada tacos. Making it a goal to visit regularly and try the whole menu!!

Holy ish this place is unbelievable and should be a Mecca for vegans in Las Vegas!!!

There are dozens of options and all are fully vegan.  This menu has burgers, fries, sopes, burritos, tamales, tacos and everything in between including horchata!

Great prices, I bought most everything on the menu and spent less than $50 to feed 6 hungry souls.

When I am biting into my strawberry cake I'll be thinking of you all, cold and in a restaurant that does not cater to you at all.  Come one, come all, this place is incredible!

Vegan tamales were sooooooo gooooood. I also had tacos al pastor. Amazing. Only thing I didn't like, was they charged full price of like $8 or $9 for a quesadilla. Which I understand paying full price for, except I was getting a quesadilla with none of the crazy stuff inside it. I was getting a tortilla and cheese only. Most of the restaurants we go to will make an exception on this. Even whole foods charges way cheaper for a plain cheese quesadilla. Sorry for the little rant there. I'll still go to this place, but this quesadilla issue does effect our judgement when we're deciding where to eat. But still an awesome place for Vegan food
Will definitely be a stop every trip to Vegas! Food has so much flavor and is guilt free. The staff is amazing and very helpful. Thank you for great service and amazingly tasty food!

Best spot in Vegas to have a quick bite to eat! I liked it so much I'm having them cater a party! They'll bring their trailer and cook them up fresh for my guests! The cooks and the cashier were friendly and helpful!

This place is great! It is very difficult to find all vegan/vegetarian restaurants in Las Vegas, let alone a Mexican restaurant. While I've tried only a few items on the menu I have been extremely satisfied with the food and staff. The interior is very small and plain, but the staff is very friendly and helpful. If you are a vegan or vegetarian this is definitely a place to check out!
I got the green chili enchilada plate and it was amazing! I would recommend this place to any vegan or non vegan.

I've already eaten here three times and I'm finally reviewing. What can I say, the food is impeccable full of flavor and so much to choose from on their menu. I've had the burrito plate as well as the street tacos and their horchata. As someone who has been plant based diet for a year it's great knowing there's restaurants like Pancho's where you can still get the food you know and love. The entire establishment is very clean and bathrooms are very well kept. Can't wait to try the vegan ice cream they're adding to the menu and on the weekend they serve vegan donuts from a local vegan donut place. Look forward to coming back and trying more delicious food.

07/10/17
DINNER

Not good.

Hubby and I semi-vegan for a while. Tried many soy and gluten meat substitutes, never liked any except firm tofu. Hubby is amazing cook, uses tofu WELL in home cooking. He'd chef a great vegan restaurant if given the chance. Recently became full-time vegans for 5 months in prep for vacation. Only began playing with dairy substitutes at home, having good luck finding palatable ones.

Went to Pancho's with friend who had liked it his few previous visits.

Woman taking order at counter (walk in, order at counter, brought food to table) initially unfriendly and distracted, got her in better mood after a while. Paid with credit card, later discovered never given receipt, so can't confirm if 10% discounted, sign at counter states "Meatless Monday" 10% off. Ordered a lot of food because friend recommended it, stating portions were "small", but they really weren't.

SALSAS (CONTAINERS COME WITH MEAL)
green: YES
red: YES

SALSA (ON SIDE)
pico de gallo: YES

MEATS
Asada (gluten-based steak substitute): NO
Chik-end (soy-based chicken substitute): NO
turkey: NO
ham: NO
bacon: NO
hotdog: NO
tofu: MAYBE
mushrooms: YES
nopales (cactus): YES

DAIRY
melting cheddar cheese: NO
melting white cheese: MAYBE
sprinkled cheese: MAYBE
sour cream: MAYBE

DISHES
- Classic Nachos ($8.99) with Chik-end: MAYBE. Mountainous. Avoided Chik-end. Sour cream, sprinkled cheese acceptable. Red/green salsas great when added to it.
- Cuban Torta ($9.99): NO. Downright weird concept.
- 3 Soft Street Tacos combo ($7.99): MAYBE. Vegetation (fresh cilantro, chopped onions) was fine. Out of 3 "meats" only mushrooms good. Supposed to come with rice & beans, never got those, hubby said via his burrito "you didn't miss anything".
- Fried Rolled Potato Taco AKA Dorado ($1.50): NO. Bland.
- Corn Quesadilla ($5.99): MAYBE. Mushrooms great. White cheese acceptable.
- Classic Burrito ($7.99): NO. Ordered w/ mushrooms & nopales. Bland, virtually all rice, a few beans and very little mushrooms or nopales.

DRINKS
Sangria soda ($2.50): YES. Arrived immediately.
Tamarind soda ($2.50): YES. But had to go to counter to ask for drink halfway thru meal.

My tacos came to table quickly, but had to ask about potato taco & quesadilla after patiently waiting quite a while.

Overall consensus: BLAND. Where's the seasoning? The garlic? And spiciness? Only via hot sauce at front counter or red/green salsas. So do most vegans, or vegan americans, prefer bland food? This place would make you think so. Hubby went to the counter to ask for sliced jalapenos for his burrito, told they didn't have any. Cuban arrived with sliced jalapenos on it and stated so on the menu. WTF?

We won't be back.

PS With exception of 2 breakfast dishes (10am-1230pm) and "Supreme Fries" no avocado offered. And NO guacamole, at all. Crazy.

Excellent excellent!

Must give this place a try.  They do an excellent job of creating a healthy flavorful dish. Had the AL pastor style tacos and they were awesome! 

Highly recommend them and i drive just to eat here.
If you're going to be Vegan, this place is high on the list of best restaurants to eat in. Always good, great portions, tasty versions of all the Mexican food you love.

Authentic Mexican food made 100% vegan. It's about ten minutes from the strip. Vegas keeps getting better for specialty vegan food. My friend and I ate here three times during our five days in Vegas. I'd highly recommend the sopes with asada. Street tacos and tamales were great too. The fideo was really nice with some Tapatio in there.

Like a couple people mentioned... This place has some menu issues. It's only been open for about a month though. Hopefully they'll be able to work out the kinks. 

I'd definitely suggest trying this place out, and I plan to return next time I'm in Vegas.

This place is what scares people away from being vegan. I was looking forward to this place because it was near campus but was very disappointed. 
I got the carne asada fries and it seemed like it was microwaved and the fries were super soggy from the beginning. The torta was just a vegan hot dog cut in half not even cooked. Panchos Kitchen is much better and they have vegan/vegetarian options as well.
One difficult thing about trying to go vegan is finding great alternatives to your favorites. Tacos are one of my favorites ever and I really enjoyed the 3 taco special along with the ceviche.

The wet burritos are amazing, as are the street tacos. Those are my go to. Nachos are good too and huge portion sizes. Enchiladas are a bit bland.
 
If you modify your order at all make sure you double check because they commonly mess up modifications. I always order either no sour cream or order it on the side and maybe 30% of the time it's still on top. Management and owner are very helpful though and will make it right if there are any issues. 

When ordering delivery through a 3rd party (Postmates, Uber Eats, Amazon) each service lists the menu items differently, and there are a few minor price discrepancies between them as well. I'd recommend they review their menus on each am make them consistent, especially when it comes to listing items such as fillings properly.  Creating some promo codes for these apps would be useful as well.

Overall good food and kind staff. So glad for a vegan Mexican restaurant!

I really want to support the place, but the inconsistencies with the food quality is fustrating. Had some hard stem or something that was in most of my food and I could not eat it. Not the first time the food was gross. Sometimes the food and customer service is great, but one too many times now it sucked. Won't be coming back anymore.

I have always loved Mexican food but the downside is that I feel terrible after I eat it. 

Something about chips and salsa before, and then meat, cheese, lots of fried tortillas, heavy sauces, rice and beans (and maybe tequila) hits me pretty hard physically and after a meal I have to recover.  It's like my systems have to shut down to process all the carbs, grease, and meat.  

This restaurant has delicious, wonderful food, and after you eat it you still feel really good.  

I have always mistrusted the traditional ceviche, where the cooks claim that the fish is "cooked" by the citrus that is added.  That does nothing to kill the microbes that are in the fish.  Panchos has provided an excellent ceviche that I don't have to be scared to eat because it's plant based.    The potato tacos are so good.  I still have a lot of things I want to try on the menu.

This place really surprised me!  I am not a Vegan but my boyfriends mom is.  He saw an ad for Pancho's on Facebook and informed his mom who lives in California, and when she came to a visit, she ate here and said it was great. 

We went all together last night and it was really yummy!  The restaurant itself needs some TLC, and I do know they were popped by the "Dirty Diners" team last year so I was a little weary but, got over it after tasting the food.  I will definitely be a regular and recommend this place to others.

I gave only 4 stars due to the interior of the facility,

OK,  So I was checking this place out for the daughter as she is a Vegan and this is near my office.

I finally came here for lunch!

1. Location - You are gonna have a hard time finding this as it is tucked into a strip mall that is somewhat discombobulated in terms of access and all the different stores.  This is the location where there is a Dunkin Donut, 7/11 and a Tropicana Theater that has older released movies for cheap.  If you go at lunch, it can be hard to park.

2. The Restaurant - Interesting Decor, built for efficiency more than modernism.  Not a negative, and really it is just okay, but boy is it very efficient.  Order food, sit and wait and you can see them processing the food or you can dine in on the dining room side that has a few tables . The restaurant was quite busy during lunch.

3. The food - Yes, I love mushrooms so I had a classic  burrito with mushrooms.  It was so good and I love the two sauces that they give you. I used them both.  The rice, beans are perfect and with the mushrooms, you cannot beat the taste.  I was about to order another one for dinner it was so good.

They offer four choices of vegan meat, a gluten based Asasa/Al Pastor / Chorizo, Mushrooms, Soy based meat or cactus.  I haven't tried the cactus yet, but if it is like a jack fruit, that should be good. 

Next on my list will be Soft Street Tacos, Tomales and I cannot wait to try the Posole.

I am glad I will be going back to this place. 

GK says check it out.

I came here after seeing so many good posts about this place in the "Las Vegas Vegans" Facebook group. Honestly, I was disappointed...

I told the owner to order me his 2 favorite dishes. He chose the enchiladas and a torta. I was not impressed with either. The enchiladas came with rice and beans. The rice was okay, but the beans lacked flavor (tasted like water). 

It seems as though the chef went through the vegan freezer section and bought all the fake meats and cheeses, put them together, and called it cooking. This is 100% fast food for junk food vegans. If you are looking for food with any nutritional value, this is not the place. 

That being said, I do think this place is a great transition for stubborn carnivorous junk food eaters. You might even be able to trick a meat eater into eating here! I applaud Pancho's for spreading veganism and was happy to see how busy they were when I went in. Over half the tables were full when I went! 

The owner and the staff were incredibly friendly. The owner kept checking on me, and he was ready to answer any questions I might have had. So although I'm not the biggest fan of the food, I really like the staff and appreciate their spread of vegan knowledge. I honestly wish nothing but success for this place! 

*They may want to change their name though, because Pancho's Kitchen is AMAZING healthier vegan Mexican food so people may have higher expectations if they see Pancho's Tacos with the similar name.
Green chick-end enchiladas changed my life and will probably change yours too. Love the place!

I'm new to the Vegan world as of January 1st but my friend who helped get me on board with this cruelty free lifestyle change took me to Panchos .

The food is really really good for the price especially being Vegan but I can give 5 stars because my Tamale was essentially the most dried out thing that wasn't even edible and they messed up our order .

We dined inside but before that we stood in a pretty long line to be helped . When ordered a blonde guy with a pony tale was going to take our order till I asked what the products were made with (I have a soy intolerance ) anyway he had Zack take the order in which not only did we order lunch but my friends got their dinner to go and asked for sauce on the side which didn't end up happening and had to be remade later on . Once we placed our order we found a seat.

The food came out as it was ready I guess but my friends all got their food and I was waiting for my one asada taco which was delicious , potato taco which I wasn't wowsers over and I already discussed my jalapeño and cheese Tamale that essentially was just a waste of money . I can say Vegan tamales I got from sprouts and made myself were better which is why I can't go to four stars but especially with the Service .

My food came last and they didn't offer or bring me any salsa or dipping sauces . There was a woman browsing around asking if we were okay but she didn't really know where my food was and later when our to go order was wrong nobody seemed apologetic but they made sure to charge for the refills .

Overall it's affordable Vegan with tons of variety and decent quality items.. 

My friends got nachos with mushroom which were okay but I felt lacking sauce ...

I really liked the taste of the asada and for vegan it's worth trying I just hope you get better help than I received

Unpolished

One of a kind is definitely fitting for this pretty frig-gggin delicious authentic vegan restaurant. I ordered the "Tuesday" special three asada tacos, three fried rolled potato tacos, and two tamales for approximately $15.00. With the exception of the tamales everything else is totally worth returning for! The seasoning was on point, and each dish taste uniquely different as it should (unlike some of the other competitors). The presentation of my to-go order was simple yet impressive. It was refreshing not to see any oil or grease in my containers. 

Useful Tip: Utilize the menu before ordering at the counter. 

The cashier was pretty intimidating he just stood their asking is that it repetitively. If your seeking an vibrant, down to earth vibe from management this might not be your place aside from that the food is terrific and 100 percent worth returning for!!

Wow, ich liebe dieses Restaurant! Tolle Auswahl an vegetarischen und veganen Speisen. 
Frische Zutaten, frisch gekocht und tolle selbst gemachte Getränke!
Gurken/Zitronen Wasser ist superclecker! :-)
Nettes Personal, man hat gratis Parkplätze und kann mit Karte bezahlen!
Extra Pluspunkt, es ist etwa 10Min vom Strip entfernt und hat darum viele Locals!

Absolutely LOVE this place  Really with they had one in San Diego! I'd be there every day! I got the 3 street taco amd an EXTRA one. Each a different "meat" I basically inhaled them they were so good  If you're ever in Vegas this place is a MUST!
I ordered from here on uber eats. The food was GREAT! Some of the best vegan food I've had here in Vegas. I highly recommend the ceviche.
Panchos Vegan Tacos is a usual for us. Delicious food. The most authentic vegan Mexican food you will ever have! The owner is awesome. Hands down the best vegan spot in Vegas !

This little taco shop is fantastic and so cute! After hearing many great things, I decided to travel across town and check them out with 2 friends. One friend is vegan with me and the other friend eats meat but doesn't mind vegan options. There was a small line of people waiting to order which allowed us time to look over the menu. We wanted 1 of everyhting as the menu looked so delicious but we picked our selected items. Note there is a menu located by the register of unavailable menu items so we couldnt try the tamales or potato tacos :(. 

Their menu has so many options from tacos, wet burritos, enchiladas, posole, tamales, tostadas, nachos, desserts and etc. We placed our order to go and everything was ready in a timely manner. They were pretty busy with a full restaurant but most guests were waiting for to go orders. Our nachos and tostadas were bomb but the enchiladas with red sauce and wet burrito with red sauce were WAY too spicey. We also had the green sauce on the side and it was way TOO hot too so unfortunately we won't be ordering those options anymore. They were hard to enjoy but everything else was great!

Im so mad that they did this!!!  Fries taste like they've been microwaved and I paid for Bacon and I get none. And it's suppose to be a burger you give me a torta bread which is fine but dang it's practically only bread.. if anyone has suggestions on another vegan Mexican restaurant!??? Please lmk! I'm over this place!

This place is fairly new so we decided to give it a chance. It's has really great vegan food. Everything here is free of any animal products. Had the enchiladas and a tamale! They have 3 different meats that you can choose for your enchiladas! I went with all 3 and they were each very good! Definitely would come again!
Even if you are not vegan this place is amazing. Everything I have had is top notch. I eat here every week or so and will keep coming back!

Super great mexican food & it's vegan! It's pretty central las vegas & like 3 minutes from me so it's even better. We've gone back a few times & tried new things each time. I really loved the Cuban torta & green Chile enchiladas w rice & beans. Horchata & Jamaica water are offered, but I've had Horchata each time. Really cool people, & we feel comfortable hanging out there. Everyone should try it. My parents are old school & confused by vegan food but they actually loved it & want to go back.

First time here and wanted to try the tacos! A little confusing finding the place because the name on the outside of the building does not say Pancho's which is what I was looking for. However, I saw a huge sign saying, Vegan Mexican Food. I ordered one asada taco and one pastor taco. Both were delicious but I enjoyed the asada one the best!

We are in Vegas for my sister's wedding and decided to try as many vegan spots as we could while here. We tried Pancho's tacos and this place is so good! Their food portions are HUGE and so affordable! Would definitely recommend it!

I had huge reservations trying this place. Every mexican food place I've ever tried is always lacking in flavor or is just missing something you can't quite put your finger on. I did not get that here. I ordered the soy "meat" mojado burrito, the "asada" sope and the potato flautas. I can honeslty say they taste better than my grandmothers original recipes! I don't know what they're doing but please keep it up. This is definitely an establishment that is bring over looked. I can honeslty say that anyone who is a meat eater will find something here that they can and will call in love with.

Best Mexican Vegan food in Vegas!! Authentic flavors. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. You will not be disappointed. My favorite are the mushroom tacos, pozole & the green tamales. Staff is always friendly & welcoming.
Amazing experience at Panchos!!! The food is incredible. I'm not vegan but I wanted to give it a try! I'm definitely coming back! Who knows maybe I'll convert one day because of this establishment!
Finally a Vegan spot for my favorite type of food. Panchos is so good & addicting. Great portions & you want to order everything on the menu because their food presentation draws you in. The best!

I absolutely love this place.  I live in LA, but the last 3 times I have been to Vegas, we have stopped at Pancho's.  The service is fast and friendly.  The menu is amazing.  One of the best Mexican Vegan places that I have been to.  There is something on the menu for everyone.  The have a great choice of "meats".  Their version of carne asada was delicious.  The salsas are amazing.  The service is fast and friendly.  I've tried the pozole, burritos, tacos, sope and tostadas on my various visits.  I have not been disappointed once.  I don't always eat soy meats, so this place is a nice treat to my usual vegan diet.  I am glad to have found this spot and will continue to visit whenever I am in Las Vegas.

I've enjoyed it here before the recent renovations and expansion of the restaurant and now I've come a couple of times after the expansion and they have gotten even better.  The service is more friendly, the inside is more roomy, and the execution of the dishes seem even better as well.  I especially enjoyed their mole enchiladas with vegan chicken.  It had the perfect balance of sweet and spicy (somewhat more sweet than spicy which I like) and had that authenticity of a real mole which I had before I became vegetarian and had missed until now.  The portion size of their dishes are generous and the food is an excellent value.  I highly recommend this restaurant!

First walked in, was greeted and happily sat any where we liked with my daughter. Everything looked so good I ordered a bunch of food, also had a wet burrito for to go. Everything vegan! My daughter loved everything! From the wet burritos, chick-end quesadilla, and classic nachos!!  will be back here for sure when I'm back for another vacation with my family. From the Bay Area, with love!! YEEE!
WOW, I am impressed with Vegan Mexican food!  I would have never known it was vegan!  The quality and freshness was top notch.  We devoured the nachos

Saw this new hot vegan place! I gave it a try and not too bad it was ok. I had an asada wet burrito. I wouldn't recommend lettuce in burrito!  Other than that great service and The Mexican waters delicious. Roaches no wonder got sick after!!!

Feels like a joke: What does a gringo order at an authentic Mexican restaurant? A hamburger. Albeit, the most delicious veggie burger ever:) My ma asserts the classic nachos are beyond this world, too. Muchos gracias. Looking forward to savoring the rest of the menu

Went in yesterday. Kind of disappointed.
Food had the authentic feel of Mexican food.
But the ceviche tostada tasted like just tomato sauce. The arroz con leche tasted like water and cinnamon nothing special. Their portions are huge so that's good. The place itself seems like it's going through renovation or something. I cook vegan food at home and it's not expensive to make, I feel like it's a bit overpriced.. it could be because I know how much it costs to make this type of food.
The food wasn't out of this world delicious but it wasn't horrible.
I feel like I should've just not been lazy and cooked at home.

Also the prices on their menus don't match what you pay for. They're more expensive by like .25.
So keep an eye out for that, I noticed too late.

Was a bit worried about getting my daily proteins, but most of all, the lack of satisfaction for my taste buds.  However, was pleasantly surprised on overall taste and flavors of this new Vegan joint that a lot of people have been telling me about for months.   In the end, I would recommend everyone try this vegan place out at least once to see if you like it or not, kinda like checking a "bucket list" if you're a meaty like me.

SERIOUSLY GOOD. the ONLY place i've been able to get authentic mexican food. tastes like it came straight from cancun! the service was genuine and the vibes were down to earth. and the fact that it's all VEGAN!!! we stopped in yesterday and we're going back today for more street tacos!! YUM!

Look no further for your taco Tuesday fix. I'd recommend the fried potato rolled taco combo plate ($8.99). It comes with 3 potato tacos and a side of rice and beans. Everything tasted great - I had zero complaints. No meal would be complete at a taco shop without some horchata. As far as I know, Pancho's Tacos is the only place in town with vegan horchata. I've also tried the Gran Torta ($9.99), which is not to fuck with. Seriously, it's loaded up with chorizo, ham, cheese, and who knows what else. Just eat it.

Oh yeah, did I forget to mention the menu is 100% vegan? Pancho's is a vegan hotspot, but on the two times that I've been here omnis have waltzed in with no idea this place was even a vegan restaurant. Notably, they stayed to try out the food so kudos to Pancho's for exposing the masses to good Mexican vegan food. 
 
INSIDER TIP: Word on the street is that the owner of this lovely taco shop was a professional soccer player!

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2017: #12

Yum! We are so excited to have found this great vegan restaurant through Yelp. We left stuffed... the classic nachos are huge. We also enjoyed a wet burrito, street tacos and a sope. All vegan and all delicious. Great find!

Somehow they always seem to screw up my order and then when you try to address it they just pretty much just shrug. Unfortunately they are uniquely situated and are the only like restaurant in town so they probably don't think they have to keep anyone happy if we have Vegan Mexican Food cravings. I am done trying to find something positive, hopefully they will get some competition.

WOW!!! Pancho's is amazing! My girlfriend has celiac, and they have plenty of options for gluten free eaters. Everything looks amazing, but we had the chicken nachos which were so tasty (the portion is huuuuge! Enough for 4 people) The chicken tacos were awesome, i thought I was eating real street tacos outside of a truck, & some potato flautas with rice & beans that had so much flavor! Washed it all down with some Jamaica and a Mexican bottled coke! I've already started to recommend this place to everyone I know! Love this place! Will be back regularly!! (Make sure to ask for a lot of salsa, both the green and red are amazing!!

First timer and would definitely recommend it. I had  one "chicken" street taco and one "al pastor" street taco. Could have fooled me, I totally thought it was meat. The flavor was very good. I will be coming back soon!

This place is very authentic! The atmosphere reminded me of being back in Mexico. I absolutely loved the food! I ordered the Wet burrito with cactus and my boyfriend ordered the asada tacos (which he loved for being a meat-eater). The service was fast and the food was yummy and filling. We will definitely be back!
Worst service ever. They never answer their phone. Trying to avoid showing and they are still doing construction. Bad customer service

We went to Pancho's Authentic Vegan Mexican Food, and we loved!!  Is so great to have more Vegan food and specially in my Neighborhood.  We tried the Pozole, the street tacos, and the cheese jalapeño tamale and was delicious!!  Definitely we're going back soon.  Ah the Orchata was do good.
Also good service and friendly.

We will definitely be back to try evening else on the menu. We stopped by for the Tuesday special but also added rice & beans & the fideo which was a personal favorite! Can't wait to come back. Staff was kind & attentive. Store was also very clean. Highly recommended!!
Super excited about all of the options and the Mexican flavors. Order at the register and then sit down. Super friendly staff and quick service.

Me and my friend decided to stop by here for lunch. I'm not a vegan, but a vegetarian, she is neither. Lol. Customer service is A1! Service is prompt and place was clean. The food was good. We've been heard of this place so expectations were very high. My biggest problem was that The food was bland. Maybe vegans don't use seasoning salt? I love my food extremely seasoned so maybe it was just me. I was also disappointed when I saw the beans had no cheese on top. I know they do make vegan cheese. The rice was good. My friend enjoyed her meal a wholllle lot more than me. The portions were huge for the price you pay so that's a plus!! Would I return....jury's still out on that one.

This place was so delicious! I felt like everyone there was a regular and they didn't have any menus so at first I was uncomfortable, but the people there explained everything to me (I'm not vegan) and I looked the menu up online. I ordered 3 tacos, chicken, beef and chorizo imitation and they were great! Served with rice and beans:) my 3 year old daughter loved her GIANT burrito too. I would say having menus would be nice, but the food will bring me back!

Came here couple days ago with a friend that is vegan.

This was my first time tasting vegan food.

Over all it was pretty good.
I'll come back one day when I'm back in Vegas.

The workers here are very friendly!

Thanks !

I had to sit back and realize this restaurant deserved an update on my previous review. 


I continue to stand tall about exploring more kid menu options that make sense. It's difficult to get younger children to maintain the plant based eating habits. You have an opportunity to truly craft a solution that is much needed in this town, and in my favorite type of food, Mexican. 

Taking this need and owning it could go a long way! It's also not advantageous as a parent to order the quesadilla and it be over $7. 

I wanted to just get that tidbit out of the way so I can reinforce that aside from the suggestion - this restaurant still receives top marks. 

The enchiladas are amazing, sopes and posole - just the way I remember, as well as street tacos and other popular favorites! 

You get red or green sauce, or when you takeout - both, and it's phenomenal. I took advantage of the $1 Vegan donuts and yea, just had to. So delicious. 

Panchos has become a frequent choice in my house and I'm always excited to try new dishes on their menu. The have taco Tuesday and follow their Facebook page for the occasional special offers or new meals!

Pancho's is my spot! Vegan Mexican food that isn't oily and wont have you leaving feeling like you ate "junk" vegan food like most places popping up. Green tamales are my number one pick, little on the spicy side but it works. The tacos whichever you pick never disappoint. 
Glad the expansion is happening as it can get a little crowded during standard peek times.
I ordered a bean and cheese burrito pretty simple to make can't go wrong with that It taste like shit the cheese wasn't even melted it was all watery from the sour cream
I love the food! Always delicious! I always get the asada street tacos! The tamales are awesome too! The staff always  seems rushed and are kinda short with customers.

This restaurant is so unique and is definitely a vegan haven! I was so exciting to finally try authentic Mexican that my friends and family have enjoyed for years! I had my first Tamale thanks to Pancho's! The rolled tacos are exceptionally good, along with all of their "meat". I tried the Al Pastor and Asada. Everything I ate here was delicious. Vegan and non-vegans can enjoy a great authentic Mexican meal with plenty of options to choose from.
Wow best Mexican food in Las Vegas!! Ridiculously amazing flavor and extremely similar to the street tacos in LA!!
