The al pastor meat is the best!!!! I recommend. Marinated with pineapple so good, I get the street tacos and al pastor burritos regularly, so flavorful. 
Plus: good French fries
YUM! Had a great experience here! My tacos were delish, and the woman who took my order (the owner??) was very friendly!

This place is a little hole in the wall with great customer service and even better food and prices!  I'm not vegan but my brother and sister in law are and I eat vegan when they visit me or visa versa and this place is really great! I'll be back most definitely

Panchos is the place to go to when craving Mexican food, Vegan or not! 

My favorite is the Asada street tacos! They're so delicious and simple, Two just never seems like enough. 

Tonight we ordered the 3 taco special that comes with a drink for 6.99. Those were great as always, my fav. 

We also ordered the the classic nachos, oh my gosh were those huge! Way more than the two of us could eat and they were delicious too. I forgot to snap a picture of just how big and pretty they were. I liked them a lot though,  I wish the cheese could have been melted into the chips before adding all the rest of the toppings. For the cheese being vegan it is good but would be better melted. 

As for Panchos itself, this place is always busy! They're actually expanding right now into the unit right next door. The set up is great. They take the orders in the old room and you sit and wait in the expansion room. The menu also looks larger than the last time I was there. They're offering burgers, no-so-tuna melts and even breakfasts. 

I've heard the tamales were good, I need to try those next time. They sell them by the dozen, just check ahead of time if they have any. 

Thumbs up to Panchos!  Yummm!

This restaurant is AMAZING. The chorizo tacos and torta cubana is what I had, the flavors. Lol man it's like having the real thing. Me and my wife have decided to go vegetarian because of how good the food is. Great experience and will definitely be back.
The food is Vegan so they don't use any animal products. It is amazing how delicious the food is. It is hard to find because it is behind other businesses.

Mexican done right! The ambiance leaves a little to be desired, but you will leave with a full belly and clear conscience :) They do tend to run out of things, which can be frustrating, but everything there is so good, there's always another option. I do wish they had a salsa that wasn't so hot, as I can't do spicy, but perhaps one day.

Great place to eat and I really can't believe it's Vegan. Must try. People are very nice and helpful if it's your first time. I stopped eating meat a few months ago and I thought I was going to die (being a meat eater my entire 30+ years of living) but this place definitely makes it easy to stay away from the meat....

Another Vegan Mexican place!! Flavors are basically the same compared to a regular taco spot, but it's vegan! The tacos were delicioussss and 4 of them was enough for me to be satisfyingly full lol - and trust me, I can eat a lot. Their food comes out fast too. Their restaurant was fairly busy the day we came in, but we got our food quick. The staff was very polite and professional. Greeted me as I walked in, checked on me while I was eating, and said goodbye to me as I left.

Only downside I can say is that their horchata was not that good. It tastes very powdery and the residue sticks in your mouth. Hopefully, the horchata is different the next time around. The jamaica was a good though - not too sweet, and has a touch of that tart flavor. On the plus side, they give free refills for the horchata and jamaica.

This place was amazing. Ordered the asada street tacos oh man sooo delicious you must try them. Had a taste of the sopes yum yum yum, this place taste authentic the hotsauces usually tell you how good a mexican restaurant will be and theyve got it down. Also tried the horchata it was great not not overly sweet. The staff was so friendly and knowledgeable overall great experience

Pancho's is The Best!! The food is amazing, the service is great and quick. My family loves to go here for lunch and Dinner. The portions are just perfect and not too pricey, which can be a bummer with vegan food. The place is clean and the tamales are fantastic. We love it

It's hard to find authentic Mexican flavor without lards, animal broths, butter, cheese, etc. This place! Woo! Awesome food. The chili relleno was super good. We've been back a few times and it has been consistent all the way through. Cool little deals throughout the week, so take a picture of the sign when you are there. It's in a weird area of town, but hey it's close to Dutch bros haha.

"Updating" as a reply for the owner. 

Firstly: I never said nor stated I am strictly vegan. NOT being vegan however, doesn't diminish nor make my inquiries any less valid. That's what I meant when I said you have a responsibility as a VEGAN establishment to provide this information TRANSPARENTLY and have it READILY available to support your claim. It's nowhere to be found. If you don't understand what I am asking for with "What are your ingredients for your all your vegan protein?" I cant help you. That is as clear as I can make it.  "Simply for the fact that we are 100% vegan, non-gmo and low sodium... your life just got healthier."

Why cause  low sodium? Just because you believe that less sodium is good for you shows me how uninformed you personally really are. 'When people say that Pancho's Vegan Tacos is a "fast food" place.. makes me wonder.' 

Wonder no more. I just answered it for you.  If I ate here everyday I would become morbidly obese. So first time trying anything vegan !! Taco Tuesday !! Ordered 3 carne asada tacos and a carne asada sope ... very impressed !! Tacos taste just like authentic meat , very tasty and full of flavor . Sope was very surprising as well taste just like any sope I've grown up on .. I finished off with the nachos and as well very very good !! I can say as a meat eater vegan food was on my top 5

The lord blessed us with this place. I had 3 trays(not plates) of food and cleaned it all up. The only suggestion I would make for improvement would be making their own cheese as the one they use tastes a little processed. Amazing though. The mushroom taco I had was the best.

This place is must-try for mexican vegan food! It's really delicious taste just like regular mexican food. You got your burritos, tacos, tortas, tamales, carne asada fries everything vegan of course rest assured!

We have YouTube channel (TBVEGAN) we review vegan restaurants/ and restaurants that serve vegan options check us out for more reviews!

We LOVE LOVE LOVE this place !! Supreme Fries with "Chorizo", Classic Nachos, Dorados (Potato Taquitos) , ... our daughter loves the Vegan Quesadilla with Pastor. It's so close to our house it takes so much will power to not go there 3-4 days a week which friends of ours do !! Our friends who just moved to Vegas, they travel all over the world due to work & they said this is the best Vegan Mexican food outside of Mexico !! It's that good !! And the portions are so generous yet it's so affordable !! Plus the owners are super nice & very supportive as we our involved in Community gardens. Great place overall !!

Wow wow wow super good mexican vegan cuisine . I tried all 4 tacos. Delicious!!! I'll be stopping by with my meat-eating friends, show them that vegan food doesn't have to be boring. Please keep doing what you doing!! Go vegan!

All VEGAN! Really good! I got the supreme fries with asada. It's a "game changer" got the pesole as well
Really on point. Recommend this place to all vegans.
Very good food, the supreme fries are my fav, and the fact that the nacho cheese is vegan ! I absolute recommend this place !

Hands down one of the best vegan Mexican food spots in town! Every time I come back to this place their food always delivers the same quality. Their supreme fries with chickn are amazing!!

The reason why i'm docking this place two stars is because of two things: things always being out of stock and of the current state it is in. They're always out of drinks or tamales every time I go in and I don't understand why. It also just doesn't look very well maintained. I do understand that they are expanding but the restaurant is just so messy & underkept. It does not feel very comfortable eating here at the moment so I'm really hoping that after the expansion project it'll be different.. I feel like with the right effort & maintenance this place could be amazing.

Authentic mexican food!! I love this restaurant.. I've been ordering from this place since they opened. I always order the classic nachos with asada and some asada tacos LOL.. when family comes to visit I always recommend this place.. the food is fresh.. the Pico de Gallo is fresh.. I'm super picky when it comes to veggies looking all old... haha...

Food there is really good! I've been there twice and so far I've tried Mole enchiladas, green salsa enchiladas and the Pozole. All three items are good but the Pozole, is awesome. This place is cheap compare to most vegan places!

Mmmmm...vegan nacho cheese nachos...Pancho's, what have you done to me?! Those dang nachos...

Anyway, I digress--not only are the nachos delicious, so is everything that comes out of this is place. The best part? EVERYTHING on the menu is vegan (and is affordable AND muy authentico!).

The ambiance is super casual: grab a menu and make your way to the front to place your order. Once you've gotten that under way, find an empty table and relax while the kitchen conducts a little magic. Before you know it, Pancho's fantastic staff will be out with your food. If you're anything like me, you will order way too much and then try to eat it all because it's amazing (no judgement here, after all, I feel ya!). 

It's noteworthy to mention that Pancho's is great for  herbivores and omnivores alike. I've been numerous times and my company is always non-vegan; I've repeatedly heard nothing but praise for the amazing food. Do yourself and try out one of my new favorite spots, I promise you'll love it.
This food is excellent! Taste so authentic you don't even realize your eating vegan food.

I tried the supreme nachos and nacho fries with chick-end to go. My son is gluten intolerant and they had many gluten free options...even dessert. If it wasn't so far from me we would be here everyday lol the food is really good. The wait was very long I would say, but it's worth it.

Food is good, but I do have some trouble with the tamale combo. It's $9.99 for one tamale and beans and rice that's it altho the menu says smothered in sour cream and cheese and lettuce the lady there told me they never do that and it was a typo so ok that's cool but still it's $1.99 for one tamale on the side and she said it's like $1 for side of rice and side of beans so you're looking at $4 to get them as sides versus ordering the combo, she understood and offered another tamale which would be $6 so still would've been nice to get a drink there..

With that being said it's still good food, the cheese and jalepeno tamale is good the tacos are ok, and the wet burrito with red sauce was good too, their just needs to be better communication as the order was messed up and also their was a lack of customer service, she didn't seem happy just bleh about everything which I've met people like that so it may just be how she is. And also they need to fix the menu asap because that tamale special is not right, not at all. This was the second time I ordered the combo, first time I thought ooookkkkk but I didn't wanna say anything because I had two crazy kids and I didn't wanna seem like a bad person since it was my first time. But second time a week later and same thing and I didn't have my kids so I needed to say something.. anyways just wanted to give others a heads up! 

I prefer taco y taco veggie burrito if you like veggies, they just have raw onions and pico and lettuce here no real veggies

I came from California to try this place out with my sister. The service sucked we were waiting at a table thinking we'd get our order taken but I got up and had to ask how the service worked here. The woman wasn't a good host for the restaurant no greetings were made just avoiding customers. Also the place smelled like a public bathroom! And the AC wasn't working, imagine that. I took my food to go instead. I tried every meat and al pastor was my favorite, the rest weren't as pleasing. I had high hopes for this, I won't come back here. Make your own vegan Mexican food at home instead of coming here.

Ate here on a whim as it was next door to a movie theater I was heading to. Happy to see a vegan place in the middle of no where. Came in. It was packed. But my food came out promptly. And it was delicious. And cheap! I got a taco special. 3 tacos for $4.50. And a tamale. Great selection of vegan meats, mushrooms, cactus, etc. everything was delicious and if you didn't know it was vegan, you wouldn't have a clue. Not much atmosphere but the food is great and I'd Highly recommend.

Brought the family for dinner and the place is big but the seating is a little cramped. I'm also not sure if the AC was working or if they were just keeping it that hot to save on electricity. We picked the seat In front of the fan which kept us pretty cool. I definitely recommend trying the chicken over the asada. If you're searching for that chared taste the chicken seems to have it more then the asada. I also recommend the sopes as that was what everyone in my family favored over their own choices that they had made. The beverage selection is rather limited. The food tasted ok, not the best but the amount was defiantly more than filling.

If anyone is looking for catering contact panchos vegan tacos. I wish I took a pic of the food I ordered before we scarfed it down. It was amazing! I ordered pastor tacos, potato fried Tostitos, beans, rice, enchiladas, and bunch of sides and my meat eating family loved it and kept saying how delicious it was. This was our first party and thanks to panchos tacos it was a huge success. Jerry from panchos is my new fave person. Their whole team went above and beyond to make my hubbys birthday special. There was a misunderstanding about one of our dishes and Jerry fixed it right away. You guys need to try this place if you haven't already.
The best vegan food I have ever tasted! My husband loves mat and he even said it was very good. Someone recommended this place and I'm so glad they did!

BEST AUTHENTIC VEGAN MEXICAN FOOD IN THE WORLD! Seriously guys, do not visit or drive through Las Vegas without stopping here. I had the classic nachos with carne asada and a quesadilla with nopales (cactus). Two of the most delicious dishes ever. Also, they have incredibly generous portion sizes and fresh ingredients. The service was fast and the staff was so friendly and helpful! I can't wait to come back and try everything else including the sopes, ceviche, and pozole! Yum! Thank you, Panchos!

Very good vegan food a place with future my recommendation to the owner urgent place remodeling


Muy buena la comida vegetariana un lugar con futuro mi recomendación para el dueño urge una remodelación del lugar
Im in love with this place. Can't believe i'm only now finding it. Amazing food, great service, and overall fantastic. I tried Vegano's over on Rancho and let me tell you this place is 1000x better.

The food is amazing. My husband and I have been coming here almost every weekend! We definitely have our faves (the fries), but we love everything off of the menu. I'm so upset that I can't remember the name of the woman that always helps us. She is so fricken sweet, it's always a pleasure to see her. They also make Conchas, which is one of my favorite "pastries". I love that more vegan restaurants are opening up in town. This one is def my favorite!
This place is my favorite new restaurant. The food is outstanding. Delicious and fully Vegan. I'll be visiting frequently. The people are awesome too
Love to have Mexica food without the added animal ingredients. One of the best complete plant based restaurants I've been to. Food is good for my tastes and healthy too. Viva Pancho!

Newly vegan(2weeks) and everyday I'm learning/discovering new things to eat and places to try. Seen this place on Instagram and was really excited to try. It was a bit hard to find, it's tucked behind some other places in a strip mall. Really lowkey.
Cashier seemed a bit impatient and not as friendly as I hoped. However, the food was GREAT and I enjoyed it.

Any bad review sounds like someone comparing it to a 5 star restaurant in the cosmo.....this place is a thriving and phenomenal establishment with the friendliest people and the best tasting vegan food in Vegas. Wait times can get somewhat long but the staff keeps you updated as much as possible and, honestly, why are you going out to eat if you're in THAT much of a rush? Also, they're a small business just starting out, you have to forgive if they're out of certain products-at least they let you know right off the bat instead of keeping you guessing. If I could donate a million dollars to any restaurant it would be this place. I can't get over how delicious and authentic the food tastes and how FRIENDLY!!! The staff is. I love this place so much, and I'm so glad they're expanding. Definitely make this place a regular one.

Today I tried this vegan restaurant for the first time after coming across the article on the Weekly magazine. I'm so happy there is a place like this in Vegas, the food is delicious, I was having trouble finding tasty vegan food in town, this place is definitely the solution, so good, I can't wait to explore their menu, so far I had asada tacos, pastor, and posole! My new favorite spot!
